name: Grand Parama Hotel
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: Jln. Pemuda Tanjung, Berau 77311 Indonesia

reviews.text:
Rooms are NOT soundproof. Windows fail to seal so the car, pedestrian noise LOUD prayer is broadcast directly into the room & quite unbearable. Requested room change, but they moved me right next door which had exactly the same problem. (Facing front road, right next to mosque).

Since there were only a few guests, they directed us (unknowingly to us) to the smoking room for dinner, leading to a coughing fit. Food service is also ridiculously slow.
reviews.title: LOUD, NOT SOUND PROOF

reviews.text:
wether for Business or Pleasure this hotel is FIRST CLASS ALL THE WAY.

my first impression when i saw it on Hotels.com was right on the money.

when i arrived i was happy to see such a nice modern, very clean, Hotel.
front desk staff was very polite and the restaurant was excellent.

i was treated very nice by the entire staff Especially Deddy.  
my room was very clean, AC was great, Bathroom was good.

every time i turned around there was someone cleaning something, even the outside button for the elevators.. the floors are spotless, elevator immaculate.  one of cleanest hotel i have ever stayed in.

when i return to Berau this will certainly be the place i will stay.
reviews.title: great place to stay when in Berau

reviews.text: Super pleasant friendly hotel with a great selections of buffet breakfast. Nice spacey comfortable clean room with all basic amenities that needed ready to go. Easy walking distance excess to all eatery place.
reviews.title: Over night business stay

reviews.text: Grand Parama was my second option after, my regular hotel was fully booked. This hotel has a clean room and well-maintained furniture. The bathroom is also very clean and offers enough compliment. The hot water works fine. The breakfast can be tastier, but it is fine. The only drawbacks are quite hard to find food around the hotel at night. Luckily, there was a night market in the city square and has quite decent food.
reviews.title: Nice and Clean

reviews.text: Nice and clean hotel close to the centre of Berau. Free Taxi service within town to go for dinner or to get to the harbour where the boats towards Maratua depart. Staff was also very helpful with information about the area
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Grand Parama offers good location in the heart of Berau town, in front of Berau Coal head office. Check in was quick and smooth. My room 308 was spacious and clean. Good sleep quality. Breakfast was average. Lounge was average. Staffs were polite and helpful. They have a free transport for airport drop, before 8 am,  and city tour drop and pickup, after 5 pM, free of charge.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Berau

owner_response.text:
Dear Mr. Adrianus
Warm regards from Grand Parama Hotel
Goor Afternoon Mr. Adrianus
Thank you for choosing us to be your home in Berau
we say thankyou for this review, this really helps us to improve our service 
once again we say thankyou and Hopefully on the other hand, you will again choose the Grand Parama hotel as your home when you return to visit Berau.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: Me and my colleagues stayed here for a couple of days. Staff were very friendly, polite, and helpful. Service was great, room was clean and comfy, but food serving takes a while tho. We eat at the hotel quite often but food took forever to served. Breakfast choices also become boring after a few days of stay. But overall it was a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: All good but...

reviews.text:
the hotel was located near city center

the location is good.

the car parking area also good.

the breakfast is standard asian breakfast.

the cons, The cleanness of the hotel is a bit grubby.

thank you Grand Parama Hotel Berau
reviews.title: a night at Grand Parama Hotel

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest
Thanks for your review 
we hope you will back again to our hotel when you come again to berau.
thanks
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
Lovely well appointed hotel with clean rooms, great air conditioning and bathrooms. Good value and recommended.
Remember this is a moslem country and you'll need to take your own alcohol if you want any. Finding it in the town was possible but the total beer stock we could track down was 6 cans!
reviews.title: As good as you can get in this locale and much better than expected.

reviews.text: This was my 1st trip to Berau, Kalimantan East on my way to Derawan Islands. I check in to Grand Parama Hotel at Tanjung Redeb. This hotel is highly recommended for its location, cleanliness and friendly service of its staff.
reviews.title: Solo travel to Kalimantan East

reviews.text: i love the breakfast here its nice food with taste of indonesian,,try the fried shrimp tempura and red snapper fish with sweet sauce...ita awesome 40K is good price...will be come here again..hopefully
reviews.title: Small City with lots of view and nice hotel with good quality

owner_response.text: Thanks, glad to hear you are satisfied with our service, if you hope to come again WE TOO :D
owner_response.title: Owner Response

photos.caption: its a biduk biduk...nice beach and clear lake ...its awesome

reviews.text: Saya dan keluarga mengambil 2 hari liburan pada 17-18 Februari 2019 di Grand Parama Hotel. Awalnya punya masalah dengan Wi-Fi, namun setelah diinfokan ke petugas hotel, mereka tangani dengan cepat. Quick respond untuk diperbaiki. Suasana kamar nyaman dan bersih. Saya ambil superior twin dengan luas kamar 28m2. Pemandangan dari jendela ke bawah adalah kantor Polres Berau. Makanan lumayan enak dan staf hotel sangat ramah. Buat liburan keluarga ke Berau, hotel ini cukup recommended karena letaknya juga strategis. Good!
reviews.title: Liburan yang menyenangkan

reviews.text: Kamar Bersih, Luas,walaupun sedikit agak old school lokasi strategis deket tempat makan, jalan 100 meter ke pinggir sungai, ada shuttle ke airport, ga susah cari ATM, untuk sarapan enak, pelayanan untuk request apapun cepat.
reviews.title: Visit Berau for working

owner_response.text:
Dear Ms. Dini Chandra 
Salam Hangat Dari Hotel Grand Parama
terimakasih atas review yang ibu Dini Berikan untuk Hotel Kami
ini merupakan penghargaan bagi seluruh staff kami
semoga kami bisa selalu mempertahankan standart service kami sehingga tamu kami akan selalu berkesan selama menginap di Hotel kami layaknya ibu Dini
kami harap, dilain waktu ketika ibu Dini berkunjung ke kota berau lagi, ibu bisa memilih hotel kami kembali sebagai rumah ibu
terimakasih
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: Prima kamer, schoon, goed bed. WiFi werkt. Goed hotel voor een nacht als je naar de Derawan eilanden wil. Personeel is zeer behulpzaam. Goed, maar duur restaurant met ruime keuze aan gerechten en er is bier.
reviews.title: Goed hotel

reviews.text: Hotelnya nyaman, bersih dan tenang... dan yang paling utama makanannya enak.. Ayam teriyaki dan Nasi goreng komplitnya enak banget. Sarapannya bervariasi ada susu buah dan nasi lengkap dengan aneka lauk.. ada jajanan pasar dan bubur ayam ... semuanya enak
reviews.title: Makanannya enak

reviews.text:
Hotel ini masih termasuk hotel yang baru di berau. Letaknya cukup strategis di tengah kota. Dan aman karena sebelahnya ada kantor polisi. 

Resepsionis: ramah

Kamar: ruangan bersih, masih baru, AC lumayan dingin, peralatan mandi ok.

Breakfast ok

Tempat parkir masih minim. Jika ada event seperti rapat, bakal susah parkir.
reviews.title: Hotel baru di berau

reviews.text: Hotel mudah ditemukan, sekitar 30 menit dari bandara, ada beberapa tempat makan di sekitar hotel. Menu breakfast standar, perlu lebih variatif. Hotel cukup bersih, cafe smoking tetapi exhaust nya kurang berfungsi dgn baik.
reviews.title: Hotel mudah ditemukan

reviews.text: Lokasi hotel cukup mudah ditemukan, kondisi nya bersih, dan nyaman, kamar cukup luas, variasi menu sarapan lumayan, koneksi wifinya lambat. di lantai dasar area lobyy menjelang sore sampai malam bau rokoknya begitu kuat, sehingga merasa snagat tidak nyaman dan tidak sehat.
reviews.title: Hotel Nyaman dan bersih

reviews.text:
Отель - замечательный, подходит для всех туристов: и для бизнеса и для отдыха, и для путешествий с детьми. Очень красивый, чистый, комфортный. Вежливый персонал, вкусная еда, бесплатный WI-FI.
После поездки на острова (Дераван и другие) он показался нам раем :)!
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.text:
perfect untuk para tamu kantor yang letaknya persis disebrang hotel.. 
staff ramah.. kamar bersih dan wangi.. namun air dikamar mandi tidak bisa langsung mengalir seperti tersumbet.. overall ok dan nyaman
reviews.title: Good...

name: Neotel Hotel Berau City Centre
address: Jl. Durian I, Tj. Redeb, Kec. Tj. Redeb Jl. Durian 1 No.9, Berau 77311 Indonesia

reviews.text: Clean? Yes. Very comfortable beds. But a ho-hum run of the mill hotel without any amenities. Stayed there 2x in the course of 10 days. First stay: exhaust fan in bathroom did not work, had to call for tv remote to turn off the tv (which comes on when the key card's inserted into the power switch). Second time - first room had no clasp on the window, so could not close it. Given another room immediately. My big gripe is that for >500K per night, the breakfast is crap (really, don't they understand by now that bules don't want their fried egg drowning in oil?), the soap/shampoo the cheapest they can find, and to cap it, the front desk claimed that they'd run out of tea and sugar (the awful 3-in-1 coffee seemed to be plentiful, but that's another argument - Indonesians seem to relish that garbage). I told him (front desk guy) that the Alfamart across the street's open 24/7 and that he should take some money from the till and go buy some. Which to give him credit, he did. So on the plus side: comfortable beds, good wifi, clean.
reviews.title: Expensive for what it offers

reviews.text:
Visited Derawan Island for 3 and Neotel Hotel City Centre was the first accommodation that we stayed while transit in Berau.

It was an exceptional stay, the hotel staffs were friendly and the room quality was very good. For the affordable hotel price in Berau, the bed was comfortable and the room was spacious for us.

It is really recommended for guests who are travelling either for business or leisure!
reviews.title: Recommended Stay!

reviews.text:
Definitely worth staying here. Travelled solo for vacation and really enjoyed my time. 

The people were polite, the room is very clean and nicely designed. 

Very recommended for either solo or couple travelling.
reviews.title: Best value hotel

reviews.text:
This hotel is a nice option when passing thru Berau, simple and small rooms. Breakfast is pretty standard buffet, not everything is hot. 
Personnel is friendly and try to communicate in a fair English.
reviews.title: Small but clean.

reviews.text:
The hotel is in the middel of the town. Shops and warungs within easy walking distance.
We stayed just one night comming back from diving arround Sangalaki.
Rooms are nice wit all the nessesary things availlable, like coffeemaker, ac, soap towels, etc.
The downside was the free airport transfer which was not availlable yhat moment because they had no driver. The car was under a cover just in front of the building. They could arrange a taxi for idr 100.000, but after a few minutes they called our room that is was idr 150.000. The trip to the airport is about 8 minutes drive by the way.
reviews.title: Nice place but service needs improvement

reviews.text: The room we got was still undone. The second one seemed ok, but after the shower we found out that the air conditioning was dripping water on the floor. The third one had separated bed. For our friends everything was in order. Breakfast was more or less ok. The staff, young ( less than 18?) and unexperienced, could almost not speak English, this was a problem since we had to change the room twice.
reviews.title: Try your luck...

reviews.text:
Everything new  and clean. The standard rooms are not spacy but the bathrooms.
The AC worked properly.
Breakfast is included but when your not the first one in the restaurant, it's difficult to get anything even coffee or tea but is was not important for us.
reviews.title: a practical hotel

reviews.text: IDR 330k for single, 470k for superior, 570k for deluxe, 670k for family room and 690k for VIP. It's nice, clean and cozy enough. Quite a modern hotel too. Just like another budget hotel. Recommended.
reviews.title: Small but ergonomic

reviews.text:
Hotel budget yang lumayan lengkap dan baru. 

Pilih dua kamar karena membawa tamu, twin deluxe 490rb, superior single 350. Saya saran lebih baik booked at hotel dibanding booked by aplikasi. Karena ternyata lebih mahal kalau di aplikasi.

Garasi: kurang memadai jika pada saat ramai. Karena parkir untuk mobil hanya sekitar 6 mobil saja.

Front office: cukup ramah dan membantu.
Ada welcome drink. Orange water.

Kamar: ranjang all of king koil. Bersih. Kamar mandi ok. Toiletriesnya lumayn lengkap. Ruangan harum. Tetapi Masih kurang cangkir, ceret penghangat dan teh kopi. 

Breakfast: ok. Menu kurang banyak.

Rooftop: tidak ada.

Gym: tidak ada

Swimming pool: tidak ada.
reviews.title: Budget hotel

reviews.text: Sebelum menginap di Palmy, saya stay di hotel ini selama 2 malam. Rate yg diberikan lebih mahal, namun dgn fasilitas yg lebih buruk. Tidak bisa pembayaran dengan credit card, kamar sempit, penerangan kurang, makanan tidak ada variasi (membosankan).
reviews.title: Worse than Palmy

name: Palmy Exclusive
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: Jalan SA Maulana 21 (Samping Bank BRI), Berau 77331 Indonesia

reviews.text: A surprise as we enter the hotel, the warm reception and adequate services made great impression on us. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The Sky Lounge 369 on roof top is a fabulous place to relax in the late evening. Value for money.
reviews.title: A Three Stars Hotel that worths Four

reviews.text:
Clean hotel, I had been stay on this hotel for the fourth time, This ia great hotel with a clean room, good staff and excellent 
shuttle bus that Will drop or pick you up at the airport. The location of this hotel is around the city so this is Will be easy for you to find a cafe or restaurant
reviews.title: Recommended For You

reviews.text: We stayed in Palmy Exclusive a night before we took the speedboat to Maratua Island the next day. The hotel provides free airport pick up and drop off to the port the following day. Nice room, helpful staffs, free usage of massage chairs in the lobby. The hotel also have a nice and hip roof bar restaurant. The spread of their free breakfast is amazing and yummy. The place to stay while in Berau.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Berau

reviews.text: I stayed inpalmy for several nights.i have stayed in many hotels around the world.i found the hotel very comfortable affordable and the staff friendly.the room very clean and all staff very friendly.i will return to palmy 2019 November as I enjoy the stay.
reviews.title: Return to palmy

reviews.text:
great location 
Only has one lift to go to the room and has big enough stairs.
Great food on breakfast many local foods.
Sky lounge Cafe so chill and semi open.
Comfort room ( spacious enough ), but at that time I think forget to change sheet of pillow.
Has small balcony due to no smoking to all room ( my room ). Bath room comfort enough and has hair dryer.
Staff have to improve their hospitality skill not as much greet upon arrival and check out.
reviews.title: Newest property and easy to anywhere

reviews.text:
Quite a good hotel, with clean rooms, very friendly staff, but HORRIBLE CHOICE of FOOD.....only Indonesia (true Indonesian) food is available. I couldn't eat anything during breakfast time.
Besides that location is good, they have airport shuttle, aircon is good and new, shower good - always have hot water and it is clean.
But still this hotel (even with Horrible food) is the best in this area....so just no choice.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text:
Stayed here for a few nights and was disappointed in a few things. 
Restaurant service was very slow, it took an hour to supply lunch after we ordered, No way to keep room cool when you go out as all power goes off when you remove the room key, and 
Coming back in the evening finding the key slot in the dark was difficult without a torch.
Towels were all threadbare.
reviews.title: Not too flash

reviews.text:
Exclusive Penginapan has changed to Palmy Exclusive Hotel when I spent 3 nights in Berau before heading to Derawan Island. The room was clean, the shower was comfortable with hot & cold water. Guests are spoiled by a varied breakfast menu and the taste was good. The price include car service to pick up or transfer to airport.
They have sky lounge bar at 8th floor, we enjoyed the sunset with views around Tanjung Redeb. If you are going to Derawan or Maratua better transit in Berau overnight then the next morning continue the journey to Tanjung Batu harbor and crossing by boat to Derawan or Maratua.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel!

reviews.text:
We reached Tanjung Redeb around 8.30pm. It was too dark and too tired to check out any Hotel and got helpful locals to direct us to this Hotel which is the nearest to us at that moment. 
Well friendly staff with not too bad breakfast. But the room is super small,  we hardly to find space to put our luggage or even to hang our towels. Cleanliness is average.  Not really sure about the location as we heading to Maratua early next morning.
reviews.title: Room too small

reviews.text: We didn't book anything in advance in Berau en route to Maratua the next morning, and this was the first/only place we stumbled upon. The owner was nice enough (though he spoke as much English as we did BI, which is to say none). The room was small and "used", but served a simple purpose: sleep. It was budget and centrally located, and accepted us last second.
reviews.title: Decent place to overnight

reviews.text: i spent a night in berau. exclusive is a budget hotel with clean room. i recommend you to stay here. price is only Rp 220.000 (20 US$) per night for a single bedroom with a bathroom in it. they have car service to bandara with pay only Rp 75000 (6 US$).
reviews.title: nice!

reviews.text:
This place just opened in Berau and we ended up there because it was the only place in town that still had rooms. Problem is that all other hotels are booked out by the coal mining industry, so it's hard to find a bed in Berau. The hotel has small but very clean rooms with great beds. The staff is very friendly and the owners invited us over for a beer and some chicken the first night. When we came back from Derawan they invited us again and even made a bit of a birthday party for me. 

Really recommend this place. Make sure you write down the address, since most drivers still don't know it, because it's so new.
reviews.title: Clean, new and friendly

name: Palmy Hotel
address: Jalan Pangeran Antasari 26, Berau Indonesia

reviews.text: They have a good service with the shuttle and the reception is wonderful and quick. The rooms are ok, you can here the other rooms coughing and spitting. The restaurant is fine for indo food. I liked mine and it was a good portion. Breakfast wasn’t so good. The decor let’s you believe they are a coffee shop, but they are not. Coffee was terrible and most food items are cold.nobody lets you know if they will make you hot food or not. My room didn’t have soap, there is a corona virus pandemic and no soap, I asked for soap and I got no soap. People coughing at the toast area, grabbing things with hands they coughed into. I know it’s not the hotels fault for their disgusting guests but it just added to my frustration
reviews.title: Just ok could do better

reviews.text:
As a white man from Australia,I found the hotel and staff very friendly.
The room was more than enough for me as I stayed  for 5 nights.
I will return again as the hotel and surrounding area caught my eye.
Thankyou
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.text: Hotel area, facilities, and service was good, however, behavior staff need more improvement since i hard to find smiles staff at the surrounding area, room so nice with a good view, the rooftop restaurant was amazing
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night for our transit to Maratua Island.  Small hotel, small room but clean.  Food option is rather limited, many street food vendors across the street and padang restaurant nearby.  Free shuttle to and from the airport is much appreciated.
reviews.title: Small hotel with free shuttle to airport and port

reviews.text:
I like this hotel, strategic, just only 100meter from jetty before go to Maratua island. With my guest we stay one nigh in this hotel. 
Usually i value hotel how nice their brushtooth, average or luxurary, and this hotel have the last.t
If their care about something like that, they will care other too.
Breakfast is complate, rarely i find breakfast  complete as hotel like this.
Note: one of my guest like, i massage machine. You shold try this
reviews.title: Minimalis but like luxury

photos.caption: Near hotel at night you can see night market

reviews.text: Build about 1 year ago. It's still clean & looks new. The of deluxe room is IDR 580. The other higher rooms are IDR 760 & 870. The location is in the centre of the Small City. Close to anywhere arround the City. Include breakfast & possible to ask earlier breakfast such as Fried Rice & Breads. 24 hour service. Breakfast time 7.00- 10.30 at 1st floor.
reviews.title: PALMY, perharps it's newest hotel Berau /2018

reviews.text: Stayed one night at the prior to flight out.  The hotel is very clean and comfortable.  Great bed and linens.  Nice hot shower with lots of pressure.  Friendly staff.  Pretty good breakfast choices.  Very nice lounge on the top level (8th floor).  Not much located close by, but walking distance to the Baitul Hikmah Great Mosque.
reviews.title: Very good for a provincial hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed here after returning from Maratua island on our way to Jakarta. Room was very spacious with a great shower.very clean. Good check in with foot massage machine free. Good place for a one night stop food in restaurant  was poor an loud music blaring at breakfast time was not restful. Great food market right opposite.
reviews.title: One night stay

reviews.text: Very small room and a charge for airport transfer where the other cheaper palmy includes free airport transfer. Moreover, we were charged 150,000 and forced to share the car to the airport with others getting a free ride. If you do that it will only make the paying clients angry...case and point the reason I am making this post. Beer prices in the sky lounge are laughable. 65,000 for a canned beer...come on. Disappointed. Better option is to stay at the neohotel right next door. Cheaper and better.
reviews.title: New Palmy Hotel

reviews.text: It's a simple hotel, clean and modern. It had the smell of smoke in the common hallway, staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant had basic options for breakfast. It had a ramp to get from the car park to the hotel.
reviews.title: Grand Palmy (newer one) clean and modern

reviews.text: Such as a nice and cozy hotel in Tanjung Redeb Downtown, with simplicity design made a small space fully functional and look spacious. Great position and closed to the center of food bazaar that open every night, only takes 5 minutes walk to reach that.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Tanjung Redeb Downtown

reviews.text: This hotel caught me by surprise with its spacious and tidy room and excellent service. The staff are also friendly and very helpful. The food, at least the breakfast buffet, is average. But you don't need to worry; if you find yourself hungry at night just go outside and you'll find dozen of street vendors selling variety of delicacies overlooking Kelay River (if i'm not mistaken). If you ever come to Berau, either for business or to visit its beautiful diving destinations, this hotel is highly recommended.
reviews.title: A comfy, nice little hotel in Berau

reviews.text: The Palmy hotel that I stayed is the new one (not the old one). It has a good view, a walking distance from the Great Mosque, and there are many restaurant and street food nearby. I had a room with a nice view of the town. The hotel prepared a wide variety of Indonesian food. There are several chairs message that can be used by the guest. Very nice, especialy for the guest who was tired back from Derawan. Unfortunately, although the hotel was a new (only two month old according to one staff), the bathroom of my room was not really clean, the management need to pay more attention to the standard of cleaness especially the toilet.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text:
We stayed here twice. On our way to and from Derawan Island. The first night we were up graded to a delux room. Big windows, good view over an assortment of mosques.  Our second night a week later our room was windowless! We've never encountered a hotel room without a window! It was however, much quieter (and gave us something to laugh about) Welcome food and drink was good. (Always nice to get something thrown in for free) Breakfast was good. Wide variety of Asian foods to try out.
As with every tropical bathroom I've encountered- a good scrub wouldn't go astray.
reviews.title: You won't miss your call to prayer!

reviews.text: We only had one night in this hotel en route to Derawan Island, but it was clean, comfortable and friendly.  A particularly nice touch was the "welcome meal" - after a full day of travel a free simple Indonesian meal was just the thing!  After the welcome meal we found that our booking through Agoda had been upgraded and we were in deluxe rooms.  Very comfortable.  Breakfast provided plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Can't argue with an upgrade!

reviews.text:
We had an overnight stop en route to Derawan Island and picked this hotel based on earlier reviews.  Although our booking with Agoda seemed not to have reached the hotel, the staff were very attentive in sorting it out and we were all upgraded to Deluxe rooms, which I highly recommend. (We had booked standard rooms).  
Whilst this was going on we got to relax in the cafe enjoying our free welcome Nasi goreng /mie goreng and juice.  The room lived up to our expectations and breakfast offered a great selection at the buffet. 
Highly recommended.
reviews.title: It's the extras that make the difference

reviews.text:
We stayed here just for overnight to continue my trip from Derawan to Balikpapan.
The hotel was small. the staffs were not professional to serve us.
I had to wait a little bit longer for check in, and they didn't offer a  good hospitality as normal hotel did. I suggested the hotel management  should train the staff about a good hospitality. 

The room was also small with big furniture inside, the air conditioner  didn't work well although we had complained to hotel staff. 

The breakfast was average, standard. No much choices of menu. Don't expect too much. 

The worthy thing was the location was in down town, close to every where. But we did nothing at this city, nothing special for tourism.
reviews.title: Nothing special.

reviews.text:
This is a fairly new hotel filling a gap in the market for a mid-range hotel in Berau. Clean bedding,  comfy beds, hot shower and fluffy white towels. There is a comment sheet requesting feedback so they are keen to develop. 
Rooms are spacious. All have en suite,  free Wi-Fi and air-con. Two bottles of drinking water are provided each day (even when one of ours hadn't been touched, which was a nice touch). There is also a comprehensive toiletries tray including soap,  shampoo,  toothbrush and earbuds. 
However,  just one sachet of 3-in-1 coffee and one teabag is provided which seems inadequate. Also,  wrong number given for room service and the restaurant itself has very slow service. Food is fine,  and breakfast (included) has a good choice from cereal and milk, fresh fruit in the fridge, toast and jam,  to an egg chef,  steamed dumplings,  and various Indonesian noodles,  rice, vegetables and chicken. 
There are plenty of street food vendors just outside. The riverfront is to the right on exiting the hotel,  just a block or so down. There is also a supermarket nearby (we bought cheap cup noodles for lunch). Exit the hotel,  turn left,  cross a street then turn left at Cafe Lope. You'll see a parking lot filled with motorbikes and the supermarket is behind them (dark doorway doesn't make it obvious!) 
Good choice if passing through on way to/from Maratua or Derawan (go to Maratua and stay at Maratua Guest House!)
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel.

reviews.text: Was surprised to check in a hotel like this. The location is remote for me. Anyway the building looks new. Check in is very fast and helpful too. Room quality is great, together with their amenities. toilet is very clean too. Will  come back again here...
reviews.title: Never expect a hotel like this exist in Berau

reviews.text:
i was happy when i heard that Berau has a new hotel. You know that its very difficult to find a good hotel around berau area, in my standard. Most of hotels there are typical old hotels. 
Palmy hotel brings a new option for a traveller like me, who look for modern-simple-strategies hotel to stay. 
The room was quite good with affordable room services.
They had a good view because near of Segah river.
And its located in strategies area, so its easy to find food for dinner!! (its very important if you stay in berau!! trust me!)

For the laundry, i have a hint for you, make sure you call the receptionist when you have clothes to be washed in a hotel laundry. Because they wont take your clothes to the laundry even you already take it to the laundry bag.

Another hints for you, you have to book this hotel at least a month before because this hotel almost fully-booked in all session.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel in Berau

name: Pratasaba Resort
address: Payung-Payung, Berau 77381 Indonesia

reviews.text:
Awesome place with very clear water with thousands colourful fish, good resto, staff were very friendly, place very clean. Very welcome for public who was not staying here for just enjoying place, swim, lunch etc
Beach also beautiful, with swing, gazebo. But kinda lots mosquitos around beach.
We were visit this place to having lunch, snorkeling and enjoying sunset, place just very peaceful.
reviews.title: Good for snorkeling

reviews.text: Getting to Maratua Island takes a bit  of time but it is so worth it. The island is unspoiled. Everyday you see turtles swimming past. The staff were very friendly and the accommodation was wonderful. There is beach and jungle here and you can snorkel around the house reef and feed the fish.
reviews.title: Remote and tranquil

reviews.text: We stayed in Pratasaba Resort for five nights in August and truly enjoyed our stay here. The room is clean and comfortable, and the staffs are amazing. Special thanks to Lusi, who is responsive (through WhatsApp) and helpful before and after we arrived. The food and drinks here are inexpensive and tasty. Lots of fishes just in front of the resort. Also can spot turtles. Also had two great outings arranged through the resort, one to Kakaban Island (stingless Jellyfish) and one to Talisayan (Swim with whale sharks). Would definitely recommend visitors to stay here while in Maratua Island.
reviews.title: Wonderful staffs and comfortable stay

reviews.text:
We (a couple in our late 30's) just spent 1 week in Pratasaba resort. What a beautiful location, with 1st class snorkeling just in front of it. It really feels like being in paradise, and it was perfect to relax and enjoy the good life after two adventurous weeks spent discovering Kalimantan. 
We had great scuba diving too, the surroundings are a wonder for sea life and biodiversity lovers.
And what a lovely staff! I only saw smiles on everybody's faces, and one really gets the feeling that people are happy to work here. It just feels good, and relaxed - absolutely no stress there, it feels amazing. Everybody was super friendly, and I deeply regret I didn't have the time to say goodbye to each and every one of the great people there. We rented a cottage and it was super comfy, with a great view on the sea. How lovely is it to wake up and spot turtles directly from you terrace??!!!
Pretty much everything can be arranged from the hotel, all possible excursions, diving, snorkeling... we could also rent motorbikes to discover the island on our own, that was great.
And the food at their resto is very good too, compliments to the chef!
The resort is also quite close to a fairly modern clinic, which can prove to be quite convenient. 
Thank you so much Lucy and everybody, you were amazing, we will remember our magical stay with you forever!
reviews.title: Wonderful location, friendliest staff ever

reviews.text:
Stayed 8 days in this ‘hidden gem’ in Maratua Island. There are soon to be more resorts to be developed in this paradise island - but currently there are only a handful or so. 
Pratasaba resort is your cup of tea if you are looking for: fairly new and clean facilities, amazing location, such lovely and friendly staff and dive master (I loved hearing some of the staff singing in the kitchen and spreading good energy), having the feeling you are only one of few people there, great diving (just snorkel off the terrace of the restaurant and you will see a colorful reef and so many turtles; once even an eagle ray)! 

This place and the experience will be hard to be topped. 

The food is good and lots of seafood. 
Plenty of activities to be done (rent a scooter, explore caves, snorkeling and diving).
reviews.title: Little piece of paradise

reviews.text:
¡Excellent resort in a lovely and scenic place! Snorkeling first class directly from the pier of the restaurant of the resort. Lusi, the manager of the staff , very helpful and always trying that the guest are happy and have the more suitable excursions. Lusi, the soul of Pratasaba,made real the dream of our 18-year old son of swiming with whale sharks. Also Jon and Jean, guests from Singapore helped him to achieve this dream, accompanying him in this adventure and recording a spectaular video.
Wonderful place with helpful staff, Paradise is here!!
reviews.title: Warm staff and wonderful place

reviews.text:
Located in Maratua island, this resort is quite a bit hard to reach. 
However, it’s definitely worth the trouble.
Staff are very kind and helpful, the rooms and the diner is very clean and comfortable, and above all, the water is phenomenally clear.
Best for snorkeling and diving.
We stayed for three nights, and left very reluctantly.
You can hire a bike or motorbike to go around the beautiful island and try the local nature and food.
Highly recommended.
reviews.title: The greatest resort I’ve ever been to

reviews.text:
Upon arrival at the airport manage so well and direct transfer to local harbor in town. 
And when touch down the Maratua Island it so BEAUTIFUL OF MARATUA STARTS, even on the boat a bit bumpy and took almost 3 hours. 
Welcoming from all the staff here really heart-full and pleasant.
Direct check in to Room ( Seroja cottage ) soooo Private and comfort big room, has own balcony and hammock with a sea view.
Nice bedroom and clean bathroom ( hairdryer provided ), hot water so good.

And you know what ?! When you laying on the beach also on the restaurant you just jump and can snorkeling, can also diving if you want because has dive master here.
Plenty of fish you will see on this resort, if you lucky you can see stingray and green turtle. 

Ah...the best food ever in this island, indeed !

If you want to arrange island hoping they will suggest and arranged so well.
Well, anyway this resort not that far from the small town and might be you can walk or take a car ( provided with good price ) it want to chilling out in the night to see a local people ( friendly peoples ). 

The hospitality here beyond standard and lovely to meet them, keep it up guys !
Gonna missing you all....I can not say one by one but all of you so GREAT ! 💙
reviews.title: Heart of Maratua... the Best hospitality ever

owner_response.text:
Dear Regarfield, Thank you for your time writing review for us! We are so glad to have you in our resort and hope to greet you again another day. Your review is very helpful and please share your good experience with us to people around you. See you again in Maratua Island, mas Reza! 


Regards,

Lusi
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
We stayed at one of the cottages in Dec18 for around a week. 
Location: It is located around 30 mins from Kakaban by boat. We took a 2.5 to 3-hour boat ride to reach Pratasaba and our old behinds were about to split by the time we reached. But we believe it is exactly because of the remote location that the nature around the region is so well preserved. 
Room:  The room was clean and basic amenities like hot shower and air-conditioning were good and reliable.
Food: We enjoy Indonesian food and Pratasaba did not disappoint. The variety was sufficient for a 4-day stay. It would be even better if there could be more variety for our 1-week stay. 
Service: Service was very good. The staff were attentive and went out of the way to help us with personal requests. Thank you very much to Lucy and the team :)
Tours: The staff helped us to arrange a local tour to the nearby islands. The local guide very kindly brought us to other places near Maratua since we skipped some places in the itinerary and ended early.
reviews.title: Good place to stay near Kakaban

reviews.text: Stayed there for 6 nights. Very friendly staff, helpful in organizing daytrips to Kakaban and Sangalaki as well as a snorkeling trip with whalesharks. Also excellent diving and a great house reef for snorkeling right in front of the restaurant.
reviews.title: Great diving and snorkeling

reviews.text:
While we ended up at Pratasaba almost by mistake (others were fully booked), we totally enjoyed our stay there. 10 of us organized a trip to Derawan, inc 2 divers. We stayed in 3 Cottages and 2 Lodge rooms.

What made this stay extra special is the staff, who were always attentive and kind. On the last night of our stay, they hung out with us, and demonstrated some serious hidden musical talents (yah Mba Lucy!). The best way to wrap an amazing 5 day trip!

Cottage rooms are very spacious and clean, with A/C that the staff would turn on when they get word that we are on the way back, so it's always cool when we get back. Water provided in a dispenser (reducing plastic bottle waste). There's a balcony and hammock but we barely spent anytime in during the day, always exploring the islands. The Cottages are surrounded by rather thick foliage which gives it a very secluded feel.

Bathroom is simple but adequate. Amenities and clean towels provided daily.

We had an all-inclusive stay, so they provided all 3 meals. Food is always good and fresh. They do have a full-service restaurant with a la carte menu. They prepared light snacks and tea and coffee throughout the day. The resort has open air dining areas, and also an A/C entertainment area with karaoke. We also took a few jumps off the deck into the water and easy snorkelling there.

During our stay, we can see areas under construction still and with that there's a bit more trash then I'd like. It's not in our way, but gives the resort an unfinished feel. The beach has beautiful clear water, but needed a little cleaning up. Again not a big deal as most travellers to Derawan will go island and beach hopping.
reviews.title: Fantastic team helped make an unforgettable stay

reviews.text: Everything was very clean, excellent staff - very courteous and happy to help!  Nearby Jellyfish lake and cliff diving are a blast!  Very family friendly and organized - everything was taken care of and ready right when we arrived.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: We stopped here for lunch on a day long tour of Maratua from our hotel in Derawan. This resort is absolutely gorgeous!  Was built in 2017 so all is new.  When we got off the boat we were immediately welcomed by the person in charge of the restaurant, brought something cold to drink, and given a fairly diverse menu of lunch choices.  Lunch was delicious.  We were then welcomed to wander around.  the fish off the pier were amazing—no need to snorkel at all!  We walked along the most beautiful secluded beach.  We didn’t see any of the rooms, but suspect it would be a great place to stay.  They have a dive shop.
reviews.title: Go There!

reviews.text:
Our three nights at Pratasaba resort were unforgettable.. from the moment we first arrived on Maratua island we were welcomed off the boat by the most lovely staff. From there, our adventure began! The resort helped us organise private tours around the neighbouring islands - here we swum in the amazing jellyfish lake, snorkelled around some incredible coral reefs where we saw so much marine life (tropical fish, turtles EVERYWHERE!), and visited a super quiet turtle sanctuary where we got to see and interact with the baby turtles. All in one day! It was some of the best island hopping my girlfriend and I had ever done. We aren't divers and yet there is so much to see and do around the area. 

Pratasaba itself was the perfect base of these adventures... with perfectly comfortable and super clean AC rooms that overlook aquamarine shores, the place is like an untouched Maldivian-esque paradise. Delicious sunset dinners over the water every night...What an absolute gem. It's so worth the effort to get there! 

We can't wait to return!
reviews.title: A dreamy resort on a dreamy island

reviews.text:
Me and my boyfriend originally planned to go to the Maldives before our trip to Sri Lanka but wanted to go somewhere more remote and genuin. We found Pratasaba resort located on Maratua Island and booked our tickets straight away! It was quite a long trip to get to the island from Kuala Lumpur but SO worth it. We experienced so many new things in just the few days we were staying there, swimming with stingless jellyfish, visiting a turtle hatchery, snorkeling with turtles and laying around on empty beaches. The whole island and the area around the Derawan islands feels very unexplored and there was only a few other tourists than us staying on the island.

Being such a remote destination I didn’t have high expectations of the food scene but I was so wrong! We had amazing food every night, our favourite was the salt & peppar shrimp! 

Despite all amazing things to see around the island, the best part of our stay was the people. The staff at Pratasaba resort was the friendliest people I’ve ever met and made us feel so welcomed and taken care of. Really felt sad leaving but I’m sure we’ll come back and see them soon!
reviews.title: Unforgettable!

reviews.text:
I really shouldn't write any thing about this spot because I prefer to keep it the way it is, beautiful and tidy.
This resort hotel has the necessary conveniences for those who like snorkeling or diving: the ocean and underwater life is just at the end of the steps of the deck at the reception/restaurant building (which is on stilts above the water,  see picture).  
Once one is finished exploring the underwater life, go up the steps, a freshwater sprinkler is there for cleaning.  And if one needs to dispose oneself, go further up the steps, behind the reception area, one will find a gents room, a ladies room, and a shower room.  All clean and well maintained.
The restaurant is open 7 days a week and is open to public (they said it's the only one in the area).  Chef Mika makes excellent dishes.  His forte is fish dishes (but of course!).  For those who are vegetarian, note that getting fresh vegetables and fruits is not easy.  These have to be transported across the sea from Berau and surrounding areas.  If you want fresh veggies and fruits, it is best to shop at the market in Berau before departing for the resort, and take them with you.  You can keep them in the restaurant's fridge.  (Don't forget to bring bananas if you like banana fritters while having tea and enjoying the sunset.  This items is not always available at the resort.)
You can enjoy beautiful sunset and starry nights from the deck next to the restaurant.  At night, you can watch a battlefield in play beneath you: big fish hunting smaller fish, cuttlefish hunting yet smaller fish.  Bring a strong torchlight so that you can see further afar turtles feeding or sting rays hunting.
The bedrooms are in a separate building a few meters inland, on higher grounds.  They are clean, well equipped, with running hot water and AC, and flat screen TV with satellite channels.  Not sure whether they have wifi, but the Telkomsel signal is strong. (Also not sure whether the staff speaks English well, as we communicated in Bahasa Indonesia).
The resort is accessible from Jakarta (daily flights from Jakarta to Balikpapan, then transit to Berau).  Add another 2.5 to 3 hours for the boat ride from Berau to Maratua Atoll.
Even if you stay at the resort and not bother to go diving or traveling to the other spots in the area (which the resort can arrange) like the Turtle station, the coral reefs at Sangalaki, the Kakaban lake with its stingless jelly fish, it is worth the stay.
reviews.title: Excellent spot to start your Maratua adventure

owner_response.text:
Dear Sirahmat, 

Thank you for choosing our resort, and for taking the time to write this informative and helpful review! We were so glad to hear that you enjoyed your accommodations, as well as the landscape surroundings. We were pleased to know that you love our Chef's dishes. It's a compliment for our Chef. And yes, we are still new and review from our guest definitely will be an input to us to be better. Hope to greet you again in Pratasaba Resort! 

Best Regards, 
Regina
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
Всегда руководствовались принципом "в мире столько классных мест, которые ждут нас и не будем тратить время на возвращение в одни и те же места". Но ради острова Маратуа мы нарушили свой принцип , и вот август 2019г., мы вернулись....  за 10 лет самостоятельных путешествий, это единственное место , куда мы вернулись второй раз... и вернемся еще и еще. 
Очень теплый , гостеприимный прием со стороны персонала, как будто вернулся в свою родную семью! Нас опять таки разместили в коттедже, в котором мы останавливались в прошлом году! Очень приятно! Убирают в номере каждый день, перестилают постельное белье каждый день, качество сна - отличное (мягкое постельное белье, удобный матрас, такому качеству соответствуют многие 5-звездочные отели). Огромная площадь номера, не менее большая, открытая терраса с лежаками, вид на море. 
Отель развивается: в этом году очищен и оборудован пляж, перед коттеджами расчищена и забетонирована площадка для see view, строятся новые коттеджи.
Но главный плюс -это персонал, всегда улыбающиеся, готовы помочь во всем. Управляющий мистер Eeng, администратор Lusi, Handayani, Marda и все- все ребята,  спасибо Вам огромное за теплое отношение! Мы еще вернемся!
reviews.title: ....И вот мы вернулись

reviews.text: Останавливались  мы в коттедже:новый (отель работает 1 год) огромный номер, с не менее огромной верандой, есть горячая вода, качество сна отличное. Ежедневная уборка номера. Питались в отеле, меню не блещет разнообразием, но все было вкусно.Выйти из отеля некуда: нет альтернативных точек питания. магазинов, можно взять на прокат байк и проехать по острову. Можно пройти по берегу и остановиться на пляжинг: белый песочек как мука, чиставя бирюзовая вода (не зря Маратуа называют Индонезийскими Мальдивами). При отеле есть дайв-центр: новое оборудование, ходили на три дайва. У нас получился приват-дайвинг (что я очень люблю): мы с супругом и дайв-гид. Дайв-гид Марда - классный парень, очень старался, чтобы мы остались довольны. И мы были - в восторге! Дайв -сайт The Cannel - великолепен: сильное течение, закреплялись на крюках и обозревали "торнадо" барракуд, с другой стороны - серые акулы и, конечно, на каждом дайве -черепахи. Персонал очень приветлив, заботлив, выполняли каждую нашу просьбу. Спасибо , ребята! Очень хочется вернуться!
reviews.title: отель для любителей уединения с дайв-центром

reviews.text:
A cada viagem à locais paradisíacos na Indonesia, me impressiono pelas belezas naturais e ao mesmo tempo me decepciono pela falta de cuidado com o meio ambiente.
Em relação ao Resort, possui excelente infraestrutura, apartamentos bem cuidados com ar condicionado funcionando e muito limpos, o que é raro de se encontrar na Indonésia. Em relação ao staff, praticamente não conseguem falar meia dúzia de palavras em inglês, exceto a jovem chamada Ageng, que me ajudou muito. Esta jovem é uma rara exceção e foi muito útil durante a minha estadia. O restaurante é decepcionante, com menu limitado para Westerns e muitos ítens “Sold out”. Praticamente Não haviam frutas e o café da manhã 90% Indonésio, ou seja, muito distante da nossa cultura. Numa ilha tropical repleta de coqueiros não havia água de coco!!
Sugeri que eles se preparem para receber ocidentais, especialmente em relação à alimentação. Não havia bebidas alcoólicas exceto uma única cerveja local. Eu alugava uma scooter e me dirigia a outro resort para tomar uma cervejinha e comer alguma coisa mais palatável.
Na praia junto ao resort, muito lixo e nenhuma preocupação da direção do resort em pelo menos catar algumas toneladas de garrafas pets e outros resíduos plásticos!! Lamentável a falta de consciência de preservação ambiental.
reviews.title: Pratasaba Resort

reviews.text:
Una bella struttura in una splendida isola, con ampie camere pulite, ma anche con ampi spazi di miglioramento.
Poca scelta nelle escursioni utilizzando spesso barche dei locali, a volte malandate, a noi per esempio ne è capitata una con minuscola scaletta le cui estremità erano rotte, taglienti e arrugginite... risultato diversi graffi sulle gambe rovinando l’escursione.
Abbiamo richiesto un driver per girare l’isola... dopo 2 giorni di attesa abbiamo dovuto chiederlo ad un altro resort. 
Spiaggia inaccessibile ed inutilizzabile, dovrebbero eliminare i tronchi e attrezzarla diventando incantevole, ma è evidente che mancano di iniziative e di attenzioni nei confronti dei clienti e dell’ambiente ( plastica e spazzatura sulla spiaggia e in acqua).
Ristorante: menù totalmente privo di pesce, servizio ai tavoli pessimo, i piatti non venivano mai portati in contemporanea, spesso senza tovaglioli e posate. 
Migliorando le attenzioni e l’empatia il resort potrebbe raggiungere un buon livello.
reviews.title: Bello ma deve migliorare

name: Sangalaki Resort
address: Berau Indonesia

reviews.text:
Very kind owner and beautiful staff. Been there for three nights but a week should be better. Saw lot of turtles, birds and coral. 
Watched turtlelife during daytime but also in the middle of the night.
Food is very tasteful, nice beach houses giving us al we needed.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text:
Spent a full week on the humble island of Sangalaki with a bunch of diving friends.. The resort is great, it is not shabby, its well maintained and the staff are all smiley and friendly.. the dive crew are all very helpful to carry our diving stuff and handles our camera gear with great care.

There are so many diving opportunities here with Reef Mantas, short boat rides out to neighbouring islands of Derawan for Pelagics like Thresher Sharks, and schooling barracudas, and even to nearby fishing bagans to dive with the feeding whalesharks in the wild. Not to mention the island has a turtle conservatory that teaches us about how turtles come onshore to lay eggs, and how the young turtles make their way back to sea after they hatch.. If you are lucky, you may even witness that on the island.

I am very amazed that for a small resort on an island that offers so much. Great place to visit for sure.
I would recommend this place to anyone who likes diving with large pelagics or anybody who are looking for an island getaway from all the city buzz.
reviews.title: Island of the Green Turtles and Mantas

reviews.text:
We stayed in Sangalaki Resort on Pulau Sangalaki.  (It is the one and only resort on the entire island; many people mixed up this resort with others that have almost the same name but located on Pulau Derewan instead).

Pulau Sangalaki itself is gazetted as a turtle sanctuary as turtles (namely Green Turtles and sometimes, Hawksbill Turtles) come onshore the island  to lay their eggs throughout the year. 

When we were staying on the island, we witnessed turtles coming onto shore to lay eggs every night; and also witessed baby turtles hatching. We also joined the rangers to do their nightly walk-round on he island to check on the nests. It was interesting and eye-opener experience to learn about sea turtles.

Diving around Pulau Sangalaki offers wonderful experience, where Mantas are active around the island. Other dive sites around Pulau Maratua offers exciting dive  experience too, where one get to see huge schools of barracuda, turtles and reef sharks.

And also not forgetting the sting-less jelly fish in the Kakaban Lake on  Pulau Kakaban; and the whale sharks at Whaleshark Point.  If luck is with you, you may encounter dolphins too (which we did).
reviews.title: Sangalaki Resort (Pulau Sangalaki)

reviews.text: I thought I was in heaven. As the boat approached the island, I could not wait but jump to the land as soon as I could. Running around barefooted on white sands, smell the beautiful fresh air, the wind is so playful with my hair, the sound of the beach,the blue ocean... the clear sky.. you can see sooo far to the horizon. Welcome with fresh coconut water and delicious local food. Diving here is definitely unforgettable. The mantas are dancing, somersault, chasing each other and so friendly to divers. I lost count to the turtles. The school of barracuda is amazing. The whaleshark experience is once a life time. The house reef is such a beautiful coral garden. Staffs are friendly and sincere. I simply cannot ask for more. Hunting for female turtles laying eggs at night is my daily routine. Releasing hundreds of baby turtle at night is such as sweet and tickling experience. I definitely will want to revisit this place. I love this place so much that I want to keep this place as a secret.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.text:
During my one week stay in the resort, I dived with whale sharks, manta rays and turtles. I snorkled in Jellyfish Lake. I witnessed sea turtles laying eggs, and the hatching of turtle hatchling. I helped to release turtle hatchling at night and watch them scurry away into the seas.

Thank you to the staff of Sangalaki resort.
reviews.title: Wonderful diving holiday in Sangalaki Resort.

reviews.text:
The Sangalaki Resort was part of our travel package made by our agent.
We did not know what to expect, be what we found was really great !
We are nog scuba divers and can only snorkel.

First of all the staff is very helpfull and the cook does a great job. My wife has a diet and the cook adapted the menu for her.
We were three days on the Island.
The island is small but has a great beach on all shores.
You can just from the beach go snorkeling and especially near the rocks in front of the main building are many fishes.
Every evening, throughout the year, turtles come to the beach to burry their eggs in the sand on the beach. There is every evening an opportunity to release new born turtles into the sea.

The crew planned every day a trip. We went to the gelly fish island, a very special experience to swim with them, we explored the coral twice and had an encounter with a whale shark, amazing.

We had a wonderful time on this beautiful island.
reviews.title: We loved to stay at Sangalaki Resort !

reviews.text:
Went at noon from Derawan, by boat. Tall waves. I even got my head hit to the boat :))
But it was all worth it. The sand is clean. And Borneo/Kalimantan's sky is the winner!
Took my photos with my phone only, without any editing/filter.
reviews.title: The most beautiful beach I've ever seen!

reviews.text:
My family of 6 including 2 teenagers stayed in Sangalaki Island Resort for 5 nights in end Nov 2017.
This is the second time we stay at this resort, Johnny (the owner) and his team are very professional , the resort is clean, food is good and their services is beyond what others offer.

The resort has its own dive boats and a speedboat for transferring guest direct from Berau to the island. 
Thus avoided the dreaded 2.5 hours road trip from Berau to Tanjung Batu, which many will vomit and have headache making this road trip.

Having their own dive boats, they also can customize your daily outings according to your group preference, which we appreciated a lot because our group has a few not good swimmers and two young teenager.
They assigned two guides throughout our entire stay. The guide will ensure our safety in waters and also show us those difficult to spot marine fishes. ie Ghost pipefish. We see all the wildlife we wanted to see and more. Especially Whaleshark, baby turtle run, turtle laying eggs, turtles, manta ray and the mesmerizing stingless jellyfishes. A bonus we saw on this trip is the ghost pipefish and the giant coconut crab.
The guides are also strong swimmers who will pull us into the path of manta ray to enjoy the closeup view of the gentle and graceful giant.

I like the day trip to snorkel at Maratua, the shallow drop is ideal for snorkellers.
They assign two guides to look after the not strong swimmer.
The water is very clear, no waves and only a small current, which is ideal for drift snorkelling.
On arrival to the shallow drop a guide jump in first to check the current and instructed the drop to jump in.
We just drift along the edge, we see many turtles and colorful marine fishes, including a full size moray eel.

At lunch time, our original plan is to have a picnic at a small inland lake at nearby Kakaban island.
Unfortunately, the shore is too shallow for our boat to go near and the water is a little choppy for dining on the boat.
We decided to go to the other side of Kakaban where it is a lagoon and the water there is calm for us to have our lunch.
The guide went to the nearby jetty to get fresh coconut for all of us.  It is very refreshing after snorkeling under the sun.
After lunch we snorkel around Kakaban before heading back to Sangalaki.

The manta ray site is just outside the Sangalaki Island Resort, however, the manta rays are not there every day. 
The resort make an effort to circle around the Manta Avenue every morning and afternoon looking for manta.
We manage to find one manta on the 4th day and we all jump in to see it.
Last year, when we were here, we saw many manta, about 10 swimming up and down the alley. These gentle giant are graceful and playful.
Having their own dive boat, they make an extra effort which other chartered boat may not do. 
As the water along Manta Avenue has current, our assigned guide is a strong swimmer and he will pull us into the swim path of manta. When the manta swam beyond our reach, they will get us on the boat, go near to the manta and jump in again. We had a very good time and took a lot of videos and pictures with manta.

A unique feature of this place is the stingless jellyfish lake in Kakaban Island. It is the only place you can gently caress the jellyfish without getting nasty sting and be mesmerized by it swimming slowly in front of your face. If you are lucky you can spot the tiny (1cm) box jellyfish - Irukanji. 

We have been to many places snorkeling. This resort is the only one that go the extra mile as highlighted above. 
Thank you Johnny and team
reviews.title: A unique place to see whaleshark, manta ray, turtle and stingless jellyfish

reviews.text:
We stayed 3 nights at Sangalaki resort then 4 nights at Maratua paradise resort then 1 night at Echo Fisheries in Derawan as we were under the impression they were all spread out 

Now that we have been to the 'Derawan Islands' it makes so much more sense. I did heaps of research but it didn't prepare us.  So I hope this helps

Note the islands are pretty close together and easy to get to relative to other locations. In hindsight we would have stayed the entire time on Maratua.

Sangalaki 
PROS
-Mgr Andreas was lovely but I think he is limited with what he can do in terms of the quality/investment of the resort, divemaster etc
-The island's natural beauty is stunning 
-Boat transfer was fantastic with good quality boats. Transfer boat had 250hp x2 and dive boat with 115hp x2. Only took us only 1hr to get there (but was very flat)

CONS
- Divemaster is awful!
On our first dive we got to Manta Avenue and there were about 3 on the surface. We were all very excited until our DM announced he just checked his tank and had only 50 bar. He was laughing so we didn't know if it was a joke or for real. It wasn't a joke. By the time we got back there 20 mins later there were no mantas - the dive was poor and dark due to it being too late.  What really annoyed me is that he never apologised - pure arrogance.
I was astounded at how little passion he had for his job. Besides the 1 manta we saw, he didn't point out one thing?! All he seemed interested in was showing off how good his bubble rings. He seemed completely disinterested. The dive site briefings were less than 2mins and basically said nothing.  
Our final dive when I discovered I was starting with only 150 bar he didn't event seem fussed?! He never made you feel at ease - checked your equipment,  asked you about your air etc
Basically I have dived in 21 countries and he is in the top 5 bad DMs (FYI: Maratua Paradise DMs were fantastic!) 

-There was ZERO mention of any marine facts. I didn't see one fish book in the place. Just because there is a turtle sanctuary on the island does NOT mean these guys care about the environment. In fact they clean around the front of the resort but the rest of the tiny island is littered with plastic (when you look onshore). 

-Dive equipment; we had to rent as we were on a big trip and the equipment was extremely limited and poor quality. I had oversized wetsuit and too small fins. The mask they gave me was so bad it continually fogged up and made my dive unbearable (first time ever!). The dive room and wash tanks dirty. It is NOT a proper dive operation. Don't waste your time. We decided to not waste our time after 3 dives.

- Quality of Diving: We spoke to 2 Japanese people that had been there for 7 and 10 days and they only saw 1 manta (the highlight for them was the single whale shark that apparently was being fed). There does not seem to be a lot of dive sites around Sangalaki - plus they are all quite sandy and shallow. Better diving at Maratua 

-Resort; there are only 8 bungalows and only 4 were full when we were there. The eating 'hall'  is dark and completely oversized. The food was super average. There is no attention to detail. The rooms are rundown and completely overpriced. The staff (besides Andreas) are not engaging. 

Overall: Sangalaki is extremely overpriced for what it is. I would recommend staying on Maratua and coming for a day trip as it is very pretty and worth seeing, but not worth staying on or basing diving at.

Also please note we originally booked with Scuba Junkie Sangalaki but they cancelled 2 weeks before as they had an issue with their manager?!  We later learned that they are based on Derawan (opposite the Eco Fisheries) not on Sangalaki - be warned
reviews.title: Day trip - not worth staying

reviews.text:
Ignore those dated reviews which dates way back. I am one who values comfort and service as a priority and have had my expectations blown away by the resort. This would be my first review at TA and have done it as i felt the resort deserves every credit. 

Service - with its exclusiveness, the resort does not stinge on manpower or service, everyone of my group was treated like royalty and family. We played with the island kids, had conversations with the crew, was showered with concern and genuine care throughout our stay. 

Location - excellent, do not confuse this place with derawan or maratua as its worlds apart. Pristine beaches, turtles coming up every night to lay their eggs, mantas lurking just meters away from the beach. being the only resort on the island, u get a real quiet getaway, not secluded but quiet. Top north location. The main highlights of our trips were 1) staying on a turtle sanctuary, 2) staying on an exclusive but luxurious island 3) being brought to the stingless jelly fish lake 3) seeing 5 whalesharks in one dive 4) barrucuda tonados 5) manta rays 6) watching the turtles lay their eggs and hatchlings scurry back to sea

Food - We had our reservations and some of us brought our own noodles just in case, boy no one touched those and we were fed like royalty. The food was one of the most amazing spread ever and there was never a moment we were hungry. Waves after waves of amazing food 

All in all, we had a 5 star experience, Johnny the owner was there all the while to make sure we were well taken care of in every aspect even joining us for activities when he didnt need to. Every staff knew what they were doing and gave their very best .

Trust me, ive travelled the world and this has had to be the most memorable trip ever. 

Thank you Sangalaki Resort and Crew
reviews.title: An Amazing Exclusive Island

reviews.text:
Sangalaki Island is one of those places that if you have the chance and resources you should go for a few days at least once in your lifetime. 

I went there almost by chance, just read about the mantas on internet and contacted Sangalaki Resort and arranged everything for staying with them. It is more expensive than staying in Darewan but in my opinion is worth it, especially if you dive. We took our own transfer as we wanted to visit Darewan also and the staff from the resort was very helpful regarding last minute changes for time/dates for check in/out and giving guidance for arranging transfer with local boats. They also have their own boat so you can also arrange the transfer with them.
Sangalaki turned out to be paradise. The resort has an excellent dive package (including visits to Maratua and Kakaban) they have excellent service and friendly and helpful staff, excellent food and secure diving, just what we were looking for. The staff was always focused on making our days as more enjoyable as possible and even took us several times around the island so that we could snorkel with mantas. We also went to dive with whale sharks, it was just amazing, a dream came true, no words!

As I said, this island is real paradise, full of nature with plenty of animal watching. Of you love nature and uncrowded beaches this is the place. The only thing, if you go and stay in Sangalaki, please respect the turtles!! Especially when laying eggs... otherwise paradise will just turn into another normal island.  Some tourists seem to forget about this just for taking a picture..

If anyone needs tips about getting there or want to ask anything feel free to ask or send your email if you want
reviews.title: Paradise in Sangalaki Island

reviews.text:
Hagelwitte stranden en azuurblauwe zee. Een paradijsje om tot rust te komen. Dat we de enige gasten waren speelde misschien mee. Alle huisjes zijn direct aan het strand gelegen. Wij hadden het nieuwste. Heel goed bed, mooie badkamer. Wel jammer dat e.e.a. wat slordig was afgewerkt. Het verblijf is op basis van volpension. Prima maaltijden en meer dan genoeg.
's Avonds mochten we baby schildpadjes loslaten en keken we hoe een schildpad eieren legde in het zand. Een hele belevenis. Elke ochtend gingen we een snorkeltocht maken. De divemaster wist elke dag de manta's te vinden. Een hoogtepunt van onze vakantie.
reviews.title: Een paradijsje.

photos.caption: Een varaan komt een bad nemen.

reviews.text: 海龟保育是一大亮点，餐食还不错，住宿条件普通，有空调有电有热水，老板很热情，潜水的安排也不错，最棒的是几乎没有手机信号，也没有光污染，很适合安静的发几天呆，看看星星和海龟什么的。
reviews.title: 一个美丽纯净的小岛

reviews.text: Saya mengunjungi pulau sangalaki utk keperluan pekerjaan. Di pulau ini ada satu resort yg cukup menarik. Cocok bagi anda yg mencari ketenangan. Selain resortnya yg unik. Pulau ini menawarkan berbagai keindahan. Pasair yg putih, air yg jernih, kl sdng beruntung bsa melihat tukik yg sdng bertelur. Dipulau ini memang tmpt penangkaran tukik utk dilindungi. Jd sempatkan ke sangalaki jika sdng di berau
reviews.title: Paradise

owner_response.text: Terima kasih telah memilih Sangalaki Resort sebagai tempat berwisata Anda baru-baru ini di Berau,  Kami akan menunggu kedatangan anda kembali.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: Satu dari sekian banyak pulau di indonesia tepatnya di berau, kalimantan timur dan menurut saya tetap pulau ini yang paling keren, suasana penginapan yang keren dan staff yang ramah dan ditambahkan lagi dengan pulau yang luar biasa terutama buat acara liburan keluarga dan teman. sangalaki resort pokoknya kerennnnnn.......
reviews.title: extraordinary beauty of the sea

name: Jade Homestay
address: Payung-Payung, Maratua, Berau Indonesia

reviews.text: We stayed at Jade Homestay for 6 nights but could have easily have stayed for longer! On an island full of resorts, this is one of the only local Homestay options and we’re so happy we got to experience it! Li and Lia are fantastic hosts. We chose to have dinner with them most evenings (at a small additional fee) all of which were fresh and delicious. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. And the jetty that drops off into the most unbelievable snorkelling site is out of this world, we saw turtles daily! Motorcycle rental is available from the hosts daily, also at a small fee. The room was basic but had everything we needed - even with a fan was perfectly cool every evening. We can’t recommend this place enough. We’ll definitely return if we ever make the trip back to Maratua! Li also owns a boat and makes daily trips to Berau, which we used to head back to Kalimantan.
reviews.title: Fanstastic Homestay in Maratua

reviews.text: My favourite place to stay in Maratua. The views onto the sea and Kakaban from the bungalows are just wonderful. And the snorkeling at the house reef at the end of their jetty is superb. They even have snorkel gear. But you can even watch a dozen turtles  from the jetty itself. Lia is a fantastic host and her husband has a speedboat so that he can arrange tours. A lovely place!
reviews.title: A lovely place!

reviews.text:
Quelques jours très agréables passés auprès d’Erly et Lia.l’accueil et la cuisine de Lia, Erly et son bateau qui nous a fait découvrir Kakaban et son lac aux Méduses, Sangalaki et ses raies mantas, et le plus beau le requin baleine….. merci à tous les 2 pour nous avoir accompagnés dans cette belle aventure indonésienne’
Annette et Jean Marc
reviews.title: Homestay  authentique bien tenu et chaleureux,un bateau pour visiter l’archipel,

reviews.text:
Ich war 10 Tage in dieser gemütlichen Unterkunft, die nicht in Berau, sondern auf Maratua ist. 
Li und seine Frau Lia sind sehr aufmerksame und hilfsbereite Gastgeber. 
Die Bungalows sind zwischen hohen Bäumen auf der Klippe über dem Meer. Wunderbare Aussicht aufs Meer und auf Kakaban. 
Der Platz ist sehr sauber und das Essen immer frisch gekocht und köstlich. 
Das Korallenriff ist über den Steg erreichbar. Die Korallen sind zum Teil schön, zum Teil zerstört. Es hat viele Schildkröten. 
Von hier kann man Ausflüge nach Kakaban (Jellyfish lake) , Sangalaki (Mantas) und je nach Jahreszeit zu Walhaien machen
reviews.title: Schön gelegene einfache Unterkunft mit liebevollen Gastgebern

name: Derawan Dive Resort
address: Komp. Balikpapan Permai blok G1 no.34, Berau Indonesia

reviews.text: the scenery is amazing, the food is tasty and fresh. visiting kakaban island, maratua and sangalaki. see jellyfish jellyfish in clear lake, along the kehe diang cave that connects the lagoon and sea. we were lucky the weather was very sunny to enjoy the beauty of nature on Hoping island
reviews.title: Amazing scenery

reviews.text: Visit derawan island with family n relatives for third time, stay again in derawan dive resort for 3 nights, had a really good time, this resort is so comfortable, rooms  are large n clean, surprisingly breakfast much better compare to last visited, would be better if fruits n milk also available for children, excellent dinner, soo delicious and many variety. What is need to be improved is first the restaurant building, its over capacity during high season holiday, and the restaurant building seemed too old, services are improving a lot now, but if can up grade more would be very good, thank you for manager dhany, very capable staff, fast responses and very nice person. Me n my family would give 5 stars if those inputs above been done 😉, all the best for derawan dive resort
reviews.title: Another happy holiday in derawan

reviews.text:
Need significant effort to reach this resort ! I flew from Surabaya to Tarakan via Balikpapan and then continue my journey with Speedboat. I took me almost 11 hours to reach this spot.

Don't expect to much on this island...actually you need to do Island hoping to the other small islands surrounding Derawan to found those fantastic beaches and snorkeling spots. Kakaban island and Sangalaki island was fantastic !!!

Hotel rooms was quite okay, the hot water was also running well...however all the wooden furniture has insect holes all over the place. Definitely need total maintenance...
reviews.title: Need total maintenance !

reviews.text: The hotel was big and has several room on the water, the beach and the surrounding was also reasonable clean. Unfortunately, the cleaniness in the room need more attention especially the bathroom and toilet. The shower and the seat toilet in the room that I stayed needed  to be fixed. The food was nice, but the breakfast started at 7 am (too late for visitors who want to explore the island in the early morning). The restaurant  does not serve food all the time, so be prepared.
reviews.title: If the maintenance was better.....

reviews.text: Just come back from a great vacation in Derawan Dive Resort (DDR). We stay 3 nights in Derawan Dive Resort for Scuba diving.  The best services have been provided from the booking period.  We contact several times with the resort to arrange our booking smoothly since it is our first time coming to this area, and they have been helping us from th beginning until the end of the trip.  One of our flight is cancelled, so they help us arrange boat transport from DDR to Tarakan, where we have to catch another flight.  During the stay, the diving crews are great with their services and their concern about safety in every single dive we do.  Staffs at the resort are very friendly, and we get lots of food in every meal we buy with them.  Although the room may be not be so new, it is comfortable, it comes with all necesary things we need.  This trip is very impressive because we get to see what we want to see underwater guided by Derawan Dive Team.  We will be back again soon.
reviews.title: Happy times in Derawan

reviews.text:
I paid a little bit more to stay here compared to the many over-cottages because it was easy to book from overseas.  The room was clean but needed a little paint to cover up water leak marks.  The bathroom was clean enough but showed signs of poor workmanship and/or need for maintenance (cracked tiles, broken shower fittings).  All tolerable.

Breakfast was a choice of greasy fried rice and noodles usually, with banana fritters often too.  It is very much a local resort.

They change the sheets daily which is an extravagance for a place that's so remote.  They should probably conserve in this respect for the environment and put the money into other things like maintenance or some fruit for breakfast.
reviews.title: Don't get your expectations too high and you'll be fine

owner_response.text: Thank you very much for choosing Derawan Dive Resort as your holiday destination, your feedbacks are very valuable to us, we will do our best to develop and increase our services based on your feedbacks. We really hope to be able to serves you better in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in March 2016. We arrived on Monday and the hotel was almost empty as all the local people stay for a weekend mostly. We chose a standard room, it was ok, we had hot water (which not always happens on small islands) and air conditioner. The food, frankly speaking, could be better, but we are not gourmands, so it will do for a couple of days. The main advantage of staying at Derawan Dive Resort is nature, it resembles Maldives a lot. The sea is amazing, it's clean and deep enough, that is there are places where you can swim during the low tide.
reviews.title: A nice place to relax

reviews.text:
We stayed 6 nights at this resort. I took the beach deluxe double room after seeing that it wouldn't be much of an upgrade in room quality even if we were to choose between the beach suite or beach VIP room.  My other family members stayed in the suite and VIP rooms, and they regretted paying more for something that weren't significantly better. Each of the 4 rooms we all stayed in had their own problems...from rusty sink and no hot water in the suite to clogged toilet in the deluxe room (and many more). 

When we were shown our first deluxe room, the AC was already on and the room was very cool, much to our delight. We checked in and started showering the children. Then we noticed how the bathroom had so many mosquitoes. We killed around 80 mosquitoes (by hand) in less than 2 hours. The bad news is... the number of mosquitoes did not seem to decrease despite our effort.  So finally we decided to change the room. We could deal with how dirty the room and the bathroom were, but the mosquitoes were an absolute deal breaker. Thankfully, the hotel granted our request after inspecting our room (we decided to stick the dead mosquitoes on the bathroom wall to prove our point). 

I don't know if it was because we came during the low season (Muslim fasting month), but apparently they didn't have any other deluxe room ready for us to move into immediately. They had to do a quick cleaning and put linens on the beds and pillows. 

The second room had significantly less mosquitoes (less than 10). The AC was not cool in this room, but we preferred warm AC than a mosquitoes-infested room.  Many nights I would wake up perspiring. The toilet flush had to be at a certain position to stop the flushing but we preferred that to a clogged toilet in our first room. The door was a bit loose and had to be locked because a gush of wind would easily fling the door open. Some of you reading this may think that it should not be a big deal to have the door open sometimes to experience the nice sea breeze especially since we were on such a nice island. You see, we were so traumatized by the vast number of mosquitoes in our first room that we were adamant about keeping the door closed at all times to prevent mosquitoes and flies from coming in. Yes, there were flies too on some days (around 2-3 flies). 

Our deluxe room had no chairs in the room and no TV. No internet and no cell phone signal (unless you have Telkomsel or XL, I was told).
