Let's talk about the level of cleanliness of this resort. Our room had dark wood floor so we couldn't really see how dirty it was. Curtains were dingy. The linens had some old stains but thankfully no funny smell so we were able to sleep well most of the nights.  The bathroom window area was dirty and I can tell they never bothered cleaning there. There was a gurgle cup by the sink and it had a few dead bugs inside (thankfully I brought my own cups). Towels had some old stains, which we didn't mind because we only used them at the beach. We brought our own towels. My parents stayed in one day and they saw that the housekeeping was very simple and took less than 10 minutes. They only swept the floor and made the bed. 

Breakfast was very basic. During the six days that we had breakfast at the resort, we mostly saw a pattern of 2 types of carbs (either fried rice, yellow turmeric rice, steam white rice, fried noodle, fried vermicelli or porridge), 1 type of egg and 2 types of snack items (fried banana, weird-smelling pancakes, or other fried things I didn't even bother finding out what they were).  Taste ranges from average (carbs and egg items) to below average (fried snacks).  I think they served tea and coffee too but I didn't pay too much attention because I only drank Aqua water from their dispenser. Definitely no juice or fruits.  There was a box of Kleenex (facial tissues) on one of the tables for 2 days.  The rest of the days we only saw a roll of toilet tissues on the table. Breakfast was served from 7-9 am and it was included during the stay.  We didn't have lunch or dinner from here because of the lack of options and taste and the (relatively) high price. Our guide introduced us to a local restaurant (5 minutes walking only from the resort) and the food was really good and cheap there. 

There was an unused rusty iron table by the docking area. The legs of the table were pointed out and my husband had a few nasty cuts on his toe and leg one day when he was in a hurry to get out of the boat. 

On a more positive note, we love the balcony!   There's a private seating area and clothes drying rack on the balcony. Plenty of space to dry our vests, fins, masks, rash guards and other things. Most of the time our rash guards were dry enough, ready for us to wear again after being line-dried during the night thanks to the cool winds. 

The staff were quite accommodating.  There was one day that we had to leave at 5 am for the whale shark excursion.  We asked the hotel to prepare to-go (takeaway) boxes for our breakfast which they were willing to do. However, they said they could only prepare 2 boxes per room (or 3 for the triple bed VIP room), so we had to pack something extra on our own since we had 5 kids in our group. 

The restaurant at the resort was also nice. We could feed the fish with our leftovers. The kids had a blast feeding the fish as they ate from where they were seated. 

The resort had staff to help you wheel in your luggage from the jetty to the room on your first day or vice versa on the last day. 

We were told that sometimes the turtles come to the Derawan shore at night to lay their eggs. The conservation staff keep the eggs in a safe place and release the baby turtles once they are ready back to the ocean. We got to experience releasing the baby turtles one night and the kids really enjoyed the unique experience. And it was free!

The water by the jetty was clear and we could see all kinds of fish and a few sea urchins from the jetty. 

Overall, it was a bearable stay. I had religiously  read reviews from Tripadvisor prior to my trip regarding this resort so I knew what to expect. I think the key is to lower your expectations so you wouldn't be too bitterly shocked or disappointed.  And come prepared. Then all you have to do is enjoy the crystal clear water of the Derawan islands and experience some of the most breathtaking moments in your lifetime!
reviews.title: Very basic accommodation - lower your expectation so you wouldn't be too disappointed

owner_response.text: Thank you for staying at derawan dive resort, on behalf of derawan dive resort management we really apologize for any inconvinience experiences you had during your holiday time. We really take seriously of all of your feedbacks and we will do our best to improve the quality of our room services. We do hope to be able to serves you again near future in much better conditions.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
I understand that this resort is quite old. But to pay for the suite room and get this condition, I am not sure whether the management does not bother to clean the place before arrival or it is poorly maintained due to the age.

Either way, you should not let this spoil your holiday. Don't stay here.
reviews.title: You have been warned!

reviews.text: The journey was long but worthed..... The resorts sits on an area that is rich in marine life. you can see varieties of fish just swimming below you.... The beach is awesome for those who like to play in the sun and work on their tan. I found tranquility here, great for doing yoga and meditation. Diving around this area also is one of the greatest.... to the school of barracuda, to the mysterious underwater caves and cracks on the wall. The life underwater is so rich that i had a hard time memorising it hahaha....The dive centre is one of the best around the area, very clean and organized. The dive team also are very professional and i felt safe with them. The room  are spacious, clean and the airborne is cold. The linen and mattress are very comfortable. The toilet are very clean and of course hot water is present. The food in the restaurant is amazingly delicious. You can request any style you can. Highly recommend... will be back  with some friends....
reviews.title: A place of serenity

owner_response.text: Thank you for visiting Derawan Dive Resort
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
Located in Derawan island, this resort might be the oldest yet well-maintained resort.. 

Room condition is a bit old with 'standard' amenities : AC, small TV, fridge, bathroom with shower and monoblock.. 
However, please ask for Rooms located over-water facing the ocean, it will give you fantastic view every morning and afternoon.. too bad that we have been given the on-ground rooms which are too close to public beach, so noisy during the day especially on week-end.. 

Breakfast menu consist of rice (plain/yellow tumeric rice/'nasi-goreng'), seafood (fried fish/shrimp/calamari), vegetables (sauted/soup), crackers, coffee/tea and snacks (banana fritter/pancake) - you may go to 'kampong' behind the Resort for more variation of food (even..lobster!).. 

We did the 'island hopping' to Kakaban, Sangalaki and Maratua islands, but if you have young children, or get nausea easily (and don't dare to take the boat ride to those islands), Derawan island itself provides you a quite clean sandy beach, crystal clear water to swim, you don't even need snorkel to watch the many kind of fishes (.. or giant turtles ! no kidding, we met 3 of them.. )...still, beware of the sea urchin.

You can also rent bicycle or just walk around the 'kampong' and find beautiful sunset photo spot, or take a look at beach clothes and souvenirs kiosks ..   

Also ask the Resort, sometimes there is an opportunity to send baby turtles (called 'tukik') to the ocean at night.. this will give your kids a memorable experience..
reviews.title: Nice option for family vacation..

reviews.text:
The room is clean but the furniture looks old and also the floor is not in a really good condition (a bit damaged on some sides). The AC is very strong, one thing that i liked from the room. The bathroom smells like a fart & rotten fish and the smell didn't go away even that i had alrdy opened the bathroom's door all the time. But my brother room's bathroom didn't smell bad so i guess its just my unlucky fortune to got such a room. Cleaning service always cleaned up the room everyday. So you'll get a new towel everyday. 

You'll get vouchers to eat in the restaurant for bfast, lunch, and dinner. All with buffet system. The food is average (rice, fried noodle, soup, 2 side dishes, fruits, and dessert). You can't order anything from the restaurant. If you want to have different menu from the buffet you have to order it yourself in the other resto near the office which means another payment. 

If you craving for seafood dish you can definitely eat that at the back side of the resort, just need to walk for about 5 mins from the dive center and you'll see lots of local houses that serve seafood dishes. But the price is pretty expensive! Must bring a lot of cash money bc there is no ATM here. 

The view in Derawan is marvelous! Not something that we can see everyday in the city. Totes worth it coming here to Derawan and islands near here such as Maratua, Kakaban, Sangalaki, and Gusung Island.
reviews.title: The bathroom is kinda smelly

reviews.text: We were scheduled to stay at the Derawan Dive Lodge but it burned down the month before. We were transferred into Derawan Dive Resort (7 divers) on the other side of the island. Mind you, this is about a 15 minute walk as the island is so small. The resort is very basic but very clean and has all the basics needed.
reviews.title: Clean and has all the basics

reviews.text: This trip is my third times to derawan.. sebelumnya pernah ke sana tahun 2005 dan 2006.. pantainya keren, airnya bening (walau msh ada yg jahat utk buang sampah ke laut).. dan kl lg beruntung, you can see or swim with green turtles. Some spot, it's a nice place to go diving. Dekat derawan jg ada pulau2 lain yg hrs dikunjungin such as sangalaki, kakaban en maratua. Come en see yourself to find out what special there 😊😊
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.text:
The room was good, clean and big with 3 beds, enough for 5 persons. 
The service was quite good, but not like other resorts the staffs were not always available around there. 
They just offered the standard service. 

The breakfast was also quite good, not much choice, e.g: fried rice, fried rice noodle and 2 kind of snacks
reviews.title: Nice resort

photos.caption: The beautiful view around The Derawan Dive Resort

reviews.text: I visited Derawan and stayed at Derawan Dive Resort last month.  The hotel is not very well maintained, furnitures are old and not enough choices on breakfast menus. Never see any fruits in 4 days. There was nobody in the reception office most of the time. We took three rooms with the same price but two rooms were on the beach,  without refrigerator and no snacks, coffee, etc. My room was on the water, there was a refrigerator and full of supply ( snacks and coffee ) everyday. I suggest to those who travel with kids to think twice about it, mainland is 45 minutes away with boat and depends on the weather too. Bring some medicines with you just in case! Actually I could say that the place is still far away from being ready to call a proper International travel destination, the nature around the hotel though is very beautiful! But facilities are important too. Most importantly there are no English speaking local, so be prepared for communication problem ahead of your stay!
reviews.title: Poor Service

reviews.text:
Stayed here for 5D/4N dive trip with friends. The rooms are average (big rooms though) and furniture looks old, the hot/cold water shower was problematic.
Breakfast was limited (fried rice, noodles, pancakes, coffee/tea).
The location however was very nice, clean and white sand beach, near the village.
Overall, it was an okay stay.
reviews.title: Average resort

reviews.text:
Just been here End of November 2014. The hotel price are 1 mil IDR cheaper than Maratua Dive Resort which is always full. But very worth staying.
The hotel are clean, clear beach. Easily observe tiger fish, Sea turtle swimming around the resort.
Walking distance to Derawan Village for some Souvenir and outside food.
Beer are expensive in this island :-)
reviews.title: Derawan Dive Resort

photos.caption: Bridge to snorkling from the resort
left is the resort, right is the restaurant of the resort

reviews.text:
Don't bother with other types of room, the best and the only way to enjoy Derawan Dive Resort is getting the room over water, they referred this type of room as "VIP".

The room is clean & large, with high ceiling and strong AC is plenty cool. Bottles of water, snacks, clothes drying rack, & firm bed. The bathroom smells of camphor, but I prefer camphor balls rather than geckos & bugs.  Decks surrounds the room, great to hang out anytime (sunrise/sunset) with friends and cold beers.  You can swim or snorkel from the deck at high tide. Plenty of fishes, star fishes, irridescent squids, green turtles in the water.  Private beach with white sands a few steps away, warm ocean & lots of sea shells (cowry shells one of my favorites) on the beach.

Restaurant on site is on top of the water, serves breakfast buffet, nothing spectacular, just the staple of fried rice (nasi goreng), fried noodle (mie goreng), fried banana, eggs cooked to your liking, coffee and tea.  The middle of the restaurant is an open space for observing the activities of ocean creatures while you dine, or you can eat on the deck overlooking the beautiful exotic Sulawesi Sea.

Walk to the village, plenty of home stays & vendors selling jewelries from the sea, shells, red/black/brown fan corals.  Villagers are mostly from Bajau and Bugis tribes.  They are very friendly,  foreigners are not new to them, more like we are more curious about them than vice versa.

The resort has a dive center that will take care of your diving needs.  

We reached the resort by air to Berau, 3 hours car trip to Tanjung Batu harbor, and 30 minutes by speed boat. There's plenty of speed boats at the harbor, IDR 400,000 per small boat that sits four comfortably is the going price. The ocean was calm and the ride was pleasant despite the occasional rains. 
Another option is to take 2 hour speed boat  from Berau's Harbor that the resort can arrange in advance.

The owner, Mr. Nawawi was at the resort, a pleasant and down to earth man who enjoys fishing and diving.  He walks briskly, and has lots of stories to tell.  He owns the resort for over 40 years, and owns a few islands around.  He is a pioneer in developing the resort in the island.  If you travels overland from Berau to Tanjung Batu harbor, you will be on the road he built.  He used to live in Perth for some years. He arranged a fishing trip for us on one of his fishing boat.  It was the most enjoyable fishing experience, the ocean was calm, and we caught plenty fishes ( I don't know their names), but they were delicious, we brought it back and the chef prepared the fishes in three styles- grilled, in pineapple sauce, and steamed in soya sauce. If you want lobster, ask them to get it for you in advance, the chef baked them thermidor style.  Best fresh fish & fresh lobster dishes we ever had dined on the deck under the stars, with friends and cold Bintang beers and the ocean rippling under us. We were in paradise.  It was hard to leave.
reviews.title: Room over water is the way to go

reviews.text: Supposedly the best resort on the island. Check in and check out procedures were the quickest i've ever experienced, not more than half a minute each. However being an old resort the standard room where we stayed was very basic and rather worn out.  Perhaps it's time to get new pillows. Bed was reasonably comfortable and aircon worked perfectly. Breakfast menu was limited and very much caters to indonesian guests who dominate this resort. The jetty is a lovely place to hang out, with a spectacular snorkeling spot just underneath. Surprisingly the corals around the jetty are very healthy and beautiful, with a relatively dense population of fishes and clear waters. There's also a perfect spot to catch the sunset at the back of the resort. Basically this resort works just fine as a base for your trip to derawan but one should not expect a 5 star service and facilities.
reviews.title: Average room with wonderful surroundings

name: Derawan Dive Lodge
address: RT 3 Kepulauan Derawan Tanjung Batu, Berau 12345 Indonesia

reviews.text:
DDL promised to give me the open water stage of my SCUBA certification. When we got to DDL, they refused to honor my global referral form from SDI and told me I had to start my training all over using the PADI system.  They would not even accept my doctors release to dive because it was not on a PADI form. This is entirely unacceptable business practice in the SCUBA industry. 

The  lying about providing certification was inexcusable! I had communicated with DDL many times in the many months prior to our arrival. I had sent my training documents ahead of time.  No issues were ever stated. Upon our return home to the USA, we sent a letter with details showing that we had been lured to DDL with false assurances. We asked for some kind of compensation. We did not even receive a reply. 

We were stuck at this remote lodge for a week. The basic staff were nice enough, but it certainly is not the place it advertises itself to be.  We were the only guests there.  The managers left the morning after we arrived leaving us with only 2 boats drivers, a cook and her assistant. This remaining staff barley spoke English and we spoke no Bahasa. The cabins were in terrible shape. In the first cabin we were put into, the bathroom fixtures were so badly corroded that they sprayed water all over the room. Plus, the air conditioning leaked so badly that its dripping threatened to keep us up all night and it had already rusted out the security box located  below the AC. We complained and were moved to another cabin. It was only marginally in better shape.  The stairs to access it had rotted out at the bottom and we had to maneuver ourselves up on a piece of rock to be able to get to the porch.
reviews.title: DO NOT GO HERE! They are deceitful and lied about their services to get us to come,

reviews.text:
What a great place ..the diving was incredible, whether it was seeing whale sharks , black manta, sharks, stingless jellyfish or turtles . Wheather you dive or just snorkel you will be amazed. Dont miss manta run ..had so many hugh black mantras swim right at me my neck hurt as someone would point out more . 
  A small resort but cozy place with larger then expected buguloes. The food was incredible, whether it was tiger prawns or fresh barracuda ( we ate way too much ) .
 Was a little Leary after reading some of the reviews but they have new managers in the last year I guess. It was ask and you will receive. The beach was clean and great swimming or snorkeling 3 foot from our room .
 Our stay was too short only a week .
 Thanks Grace and Steve and the rest of the staff.
reviews.title: Mister and mrs

reviews.text:
Derawan Dive Lodge comprises a small collection of rooms on the beach and a jetty which houses the kitchen and dining area.  It was lovely to be able to sit outside and watch the sun go down and eat outside every night without a single fly or mosquito in sight.  The food was wonderful, varied and plentiful.

Diving was by boat and was very efficiently managed by the dive-team.  The crew were all very helpful.  I think in retrospect that the guides should have been shared around the group rather than having the same one for the duration of the trip - some of the guides were better than others!

One of the great attractions of Derawan is the huge biodiversity of the sealife to be found.  From Mantas to Pygmy seahorses to stingless jellyfish and, of course, abundant large turtles.  As underwater photographers, we were not disappointed.

I would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Well-run dive lodge that perfectly caters for divers.

reviews.text:
First off let me say that I will not write anything in a review that hasn't already been raised with the management .  What can I say about a place that has such great potential but just misses the mark.  The rooms are very nice, comfortable and spacious.  Ant control would help as there was a steady stream crawling up the back wall and across my pillow most nights.  The showers - well someone is going to fall through the floor one of these days.  On arrival I asked for soap in the bathroom and was told to buy it in the village. To be fair the manager did follow up when asked about something, but you did have to ask - he doesn't proactively check things out.
The staff really could use a good manager.  They lounge about on the floor playing video games on their phones in the only common space available.  In a torrential downpour we had to stand in the doorway. Don't expect to swim in the water in front of the resort as it is littered with broken glass.
The dive boats are comfortable but the one we were using didn't have a first aid kit (until we asked) or even a door on the head - ladies beware of other passing boats!  Again, the manager seemed surprised when I raised the door issue.
Stay here is you must, just be prepared and hope that the owner is willing to give the place a little attention because it would be worth it.
reviews.title: Needs attention and better management

owner_response.text: We are happy to say that we have done a lot of improvement during covid period and have opened to our clients again. two big groups in November and December has confirmed that we have nailed those improvements. Thank you so much for your feed back.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, Derawan island itself is a bit run down, but it is under 30 minutes by boat from the mainland, and the closest of the islands.  From what we could see Derawan Dive Lodge was the best choice on the island. They cater to divers and had an excellent dive crew and different trips with 3 dives per day.  For those who don’t dive, the snorkeling on the trips is great,with the water with great visibility and abundant coral and fish. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but are in need of updating.  Meals are served on an open patio at the end of the pier.  Meals are basic Indonesian buffet style, but they will accommodate specific requests ahead of time.
reviews.title: Best on the Island

reviews.text:
Our two night experience at Derawan Dive Lodge was fantastic. It is the perfect base for adventures around Derawan. We made the most of the stormy weather at the time by visiting some very cool nearby sand banks that arise during low tide. Other than that we cruised around the whole of Derawan island during the day, always looking forward to coming back to our cosy, super clean, beach chic AC room! My girlfriend and I saw numerous huge turtles during breakfast, just looking into the water from our table on the jetty! Crazy. 

Would 100% recommend and can't wait to return :)
reviews.title: Peaceful, clean and modern lodge with great service!

reviews.text: Stayed at DDL in August with my boyfriend when travelling around in Borneo and had a really nice couple of days. I really liked the smaller size of the resort as well as the nice and clean rooms! If you’re coming to Derawan island I would highly recommend DDL for your stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms!

reviews.text:
My wife and I spent two weeks here. We have to say every thing is beyond our expectation.  I even got a birthday cake during our stay.
Food is very various and delicious. Diving is exciting, you could almost find anything you want to see. Specially with Manta,Shark and Barracuda. Their boats seems the best and biggest diving boats in Derawan. Lodge staffs and boat crews are always friendly and helpful. Specially our dive master Ban. He filmed a amazing barracuda circling video for us. Just feel two weeks is too short.
reviews.title: Thanks DDL

reviews.text:
The resort is cosy, with only 10 wooden rooms right on the beach. The restaurant is out at the end of the wooden pier, and the dive center is part of the resort. Dive boats anchor at the beach so it's just a few steps away from your room.

Rooms are wooden, with Room 1 and 10 being separate units, all wood construction, airconditioned, with in room safe, large airy bathroom with hot water. Rooms are clean and comfortable, not much more you could ask for a dive resort. Small touches such as buckets of water to wash the feet of sand before entering the rooms make a big difference.  All rooms have a wooden balcony, and mine had bean bags to lounge on. 

The staff are very friendly, especially at the restaurant, which serves up excellent food. There was always a snack around teatime, with hot ginger tea or iced orange juice and local delicacies. 

The dive operations are professional and slick.  Dive boats are large and comfortable, equipped with a toilet on board, hot and cold drinking water and snacks. The boat crew bring fresh towels along for the days' dive, packed lunch and spare tanks for multiple dives.  The service on board is excellent, with the boatman helping divers, gearing up and changing tanks after every dive and cleaning up afterwards. 

Dive masters were professional and knew their job well, with a small ratio of divers to dive master - ranging from just two to about five in my dive party.  Currents are strong at various dive sites, so listen carefully to your dive master. 

Dives are fun and comfortable, with dry towels, music (our dive master brought his music player along) and snacks.  Dive equipment is well organised after every dive - fins, masks, weight belts all in place beside the fresh air tank. 

This is not a luxurious or swanky resort, but the coziness, friendliness and warmth, excellent service and sheer convenience of everything being so close by rates a 5-star rating.
reviews.title: Cosy resort, great service, superb dive experience

reviews.text:
First of all big thank you to the resort manager Chris and the team, who are always friendly, helpful and trying to make your stay unforgettable. 
Also thank you to the GM Daniel for all the infos and great customer service prior to the trip. 

The resort is recently renovated and from a good standard. Only a hot shower after a long day of diving would have been nice, but staying on a small island you shouldn’t ask for too much. 
Food is basic, but delicious. 

Derawan itself has nothing making the trip worth without diving, but diving in the Derawan Archipel is just incredible. The variety of possibilities as well as different stuff to see is just amazing - Mantas, Whale Sharks, Zebra Sharks, Thresher Sharks, Pygmy Sear-horses, Black Tip, White Tip, huge schools of Barracuda.... name it and if you are lucky you can find it. So the dives were definitely worth doing the trip. DDL has by far the best two dive boats in Archipelago with toilet and plenty of space on board. Something to for sure considerate with dive days spending almost the full day including lunch on the boats. 

Our dive guides were also just amazing trying to make everything possible and finding the smallest sea life creatures for you. 
Only pity regarding diving is the dive master Simon. Other to all the other staff he is not able or willing to greet the guests, neither does he do proper briefings. Anyways as the guides and the boat staff are doing a great job, we just ignored him. So did most of the other guests diving with us too. 

So to sum up definitely worth going there even it is from almost all places of the world quite a hustle to go there. The nature will pay back the effort of the trip. Just be aware that you will spend a lot of time on boats as some of the dive sites are far away from each other and that visibility can be bad depending on the weather. 
And most important make sure you are comfortable with strong currents.
reviews.title: Nice Resort with super nice staff and incredible dive sites within 1h boat ride

reviews.text: A whole week at a dive resort when I'm not a diver? No way, I told my daughter - I really will be the figurative fish out of water! All my apprehensions were laid to rest when we stepped off the speedboat onto the sands of Derawan Dive Lodge, part of the Tasik Dive Resorts group. ''Of course you can go out on the boat'', said Dan Green. ''First time snorkelling in the ocean? No worries! We'll give you a guide who will show you amazing stuff without bossing you around.'' As it turned out, Dan was my guide on my first ever snorkelling experience and showed me a magical world under the waters off Kakaban Island, the destination for that day. A short walk inland and we came to one of the only two freshwater jellyfish lakes in the world. Viewing those exquisitely delicate creatures up close will be one of the most unforgettable encounters of my life. After that I went out every single day with the divers, the most inclusive and fun group of people to have around. As for the other faciliies at DDL, it's open house all day long with super-friendly staff who are ever ready to oblige. You can help yourself to tea or coffee or a cold can of Bintang (DDL trusts you to note your consumption of the last in a file on top the fridge) while gourmet meals and yummy snacks exit the kitchen at regular intervals. The culmination was a barbecue on the beach. An enormous grouper, done to a crisp turn on the coals. Perfection! The rooms are large, very clean and tastefully furnished. Thoughtful details like a double plug-point with two USB ports make an immense difference to travellers who want to charge laptops, mobiles and batteries. Berry has already planned our return in 2018 - this time I am going to learn diving from their PADI-certified instructor. I want to be a dashing deep-sea diver, too!
reviews.title: Even Non-Divers Have A Great Time!

owner_response.text:
Namaste Naomi,
Thank you for your kind review and compliment. Derawan Dive Lodge can accommodate the needs of both divers and no divers. We are looking forward to dive together along with Berry next year. Have a great day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
I was there with my friends in mid-August 2017.
The accommodations were nice, the food was good and sufficient. 
The resort is not big, it has about 10-12 rooms, every room is spacious and comfortable.
One of my friend's room that is close to the beach, his slippers was left outside the room and lost due to the high tide in the morning (hahha XD .......). So u can imagine how close to the beach is that, and u can buy some drinks and stuffs from the village that just right behind the resort.

During our stay, 2 sea turtles always swam around the dining area of the resort, so I just jumped into the water and swam with the 2 turtles and took some video too.
The diving crew also showed us the baby guitar shark and baby sea turtle around the beach during the night time.

The diving experience was nice, we went to Derawan, Sangalaki, Maratua & Kakaban islands and we had seen many small critters and big creatures. 
We swam with 2 manta ray in shallow water when diving in Sangalaki. That was amazing.

There is a dive site called big fish country, the barracuda storm is wonderful and the place is having strong current near a channel. Must go for experienced divers.

One of my friends he lost the Olympus TG4 camera under the water (how come it could be lost, hahha XD) in the second day of our diving, but the DM found that under the water after we left.
So the manager Christ email me about that, with such luck and the help of nice crew there, the camera could be brought back to HK by another nice diver guest (her name is Evelyn, thanks a lot to her).

We are very much appreciated by the effort that was made by the Dearwan dive lodge. Hope to visit there soon and explore more wonderful dive sites there.
reviews.title: Derawan dive trip

owner_response.text:
Hi Johnny,
Thank you for your kind review and compliment. We are glad the camera can be found after many years and are now safely returned to the owner. Looking forward to serve you and your guests again soon.
Have a great day.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
Derawan dive lodge was a nice place to do my padi open water course. The instructor was strict and thought me everything about save diving. He knew a lot about the different kinds of species underwater. Although the style of teaching was not always the way I would like to/and used to. Sometimes the instructor did not want to explain the skill on forehand, which is proven to be more successful in learning progress. This made me nervous during the course as I didn't know what to do or what I did wrong. But as a teacher educator it is sometimes difficult to let lose and don't interrupt the style of the instructor. Still I am happy that I finished my course at derawan. 

The dive equipment en boat were very good!!!

The bungalow was very nice and de food really good! Plenty of vegetables as well. 

They take good care of you.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

owner_response.text:
Hi Marit,
Thank you for your kind review and feedback. Congratulations on becoming a certified diver. Welcome to the family of Tasik Divers underwater world explorer. We are looking forward to welcome you again soon. Have a great day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
We found this place from the internet, after some exchange email asking about the trip, we decided to take 3 nights package with 2 days diving, 3 dives per day.
The lodge is quiet new, we totally love it, no complain at all. Good room, nice beach, super nice staff and great diving equipments. The easiest way to get there is from Berau airport, then around 3 hours drive to tanjung batu port, then 30 mins buy boat to the lodge.
reviews.title: Diving trip at Derawan

owner_response.text:
Hi Pak Agung,
Thank you for your kind review. We are glad you are enjoying our accommodation and diving services. We certainly looking forward to welcome you back in Derawan Dive Lodge soon. Have a great day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
This resort definitely has potential, but isn't quite there yet. The entire resort was recently rebuilt, and the design is great. Rooms are very spacious and well-equipped, and we were impressed at the artsy detail. Unfortunately, the dark walls, dark room, and high ceilings really draw the heat of the day and the AC was not nearly sufficient to cool the room till well after sundown. There really isn't any shade on the property that is in the breeze, so there was no where to relax in the afternoon. The other issue we had was with the ants. We expected some bugs, but our room seemed to have an infestation. 

However, we thought those issues were minor and easily solved. Chris and the rest of staff were great and did whatever they could to try to make us comfortable. All the meals plentiful and tasty, and the booking process was efficient. After walking around a little, we agreed this was probably one of the best lodging options on the island.

We dived everyday, but didn't think quite as highly of the dive operation, Tasik Divers. See my review on their listing for more.
reviews.title: Good option on Derawan

owner_response.text:
Hi,
Thank you for your kind review and input. I am happy to inform you that we already do some maintenance according to our guests feedback such as yours. We certainly hope to be able to serve you again in the near future with a better services and facilities.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
Excellent stay 3 nights two days in Derawan Dive resort. The diving guide and its team (Tasik Diver) is excellent. They use real diving boat fully equip. The room is clean and spacious. Food is okay. All are sea view rooms. The only down side is currently they don't have wifi.
See at least 15 mantas at Manta parade in Sangalaki island..circle around until we have to surface. Will defenitely back. Still many diving spots need to be visit in this area. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Dive resort and package Derawan

reviews.text:
Our experience of Derawan dive lodge was very disappointing. 2 dive boats just left sunk on the beach. Broken glass just off the beach so didn't want to risk swimming . 3 sun beds which we couldn't use because a dog with fleas &  a nasty cancer growth in his ear slept on them. Felt sorry for the dog. Our room wasn't cleaned for 3 days, until we complained. We were doing it ourselves. The restaurant needed clean linen on the tables .They looked like they hadn't been changed for weeks .First morning we were few minutes late getting up . The dive guide was angry & banging his watch saying we have to go now. My wife miss the first dive because of this .  . So he just ignored us for the rest of the trip . Only spoke when he had too. Went to Sangalaki on a cramped speed boat . After the dive went onto the island for the surface interval. The dive guide told us to stay at the front of the hotel . He just left us & went off to talk to the caretaker. We thought we would come back to the island for lunch. No it was spent in this very small boat moored off the jetty. Guide sat having his lunch with his back towards us . 
They changed the days diving to suit other people no consideration of what we wanted to do . We were just told on the morning . My wife again missed out on a days diving which was very upsetting.With afew simple cosmetic  changes the place could be really  good.The turtles  & Mantas  we saw were great. The  most  enjoyable  part of our trip was the local village  . The resort looks & feels forgotten: even the Indonesian  flag which hangs ripped & sad on its pole. We spent  alot of money & time travelling  to get here .Not worth  it.
reviews.title: So far yet so so disappointed.

reviews.text:
You most likely go to Derawan to explore Sangalaki, Kakaban and Maratua. Derawan itself has a large amount of turtles swimming around, but there are just a few small places with some corals and any dives we did were made at the other islands. The lodge is working hard to keep the small beach tidy, but there is trash floating in anyway.
We stayed four people in a family bungalow, but I would recommend to choose two smaller bungalows instead for a family of four. 
The food served was ok and there are a bunch of cheaper restaurants in the small village. The service and dive masters were great! We got all the help we needed.
You should go to the jellyfish lake at Kakaban and go snorkleiong for mantas at Sangalaki. Sangalaki is an gorgeous island for a lunch as well.
reviews.title: The gateway to Sangalaki, Kakaban and Maratua

reviews.text:
I've been with Tasik divers resort once in Manado (which was great) and unfortunately this one in Derawan is subpar. 

Pros:
- Good food
- Friendly staff
- Room facilities work well

Cons:
- Dive trip management. We hardly saw any mantas in Sangalaki which was supposed to be the cleaning station. My friends and I had fight the current for 15 minutes straight, knelt down in the sand looking at the blue for 5 minutes, repeat 2X. Only two mantas in two dives. They should have given us more info that on that particular week there is rare sighting so maybe they could suggest other places. 
- No sufficient briefing in the last three dives. First six dives had pictures and all.
- They should invest more on gear boxes so everything is more neat in the boat. Not everyone in my group has gear bags. 
- We have to wash and dry our equipment ourselves. Many resorts I've been offer this kind of service.
reviews.title: Okay resort, disappointing dives

reviews.text:
Me and my wife are urged to visit derawan 2 years ago. We are randomly select the flight to derawan, cause we fell it's now or never moment during our second honeymoon. With tight budget, we are planning to have a dive lesson there as we missed our opportunity when we visit Gili Terawangan. Then searching where should we take a dive course, we found that DDL open a NAUI dive course. But with the tight budget, we couldn't afford to stay there. 
When we had a look at the room, it's very cozy. Shame we missed to stay there. They provide 3 times meal per day. So it's common they charged the visitors with 550k idr per night. What I love about them, is the preserve the beach clean. Since derawan island is the most inhibitant island, you will find so many trash, that's what makes the beach dirty. Lack of rubbish bin and awareness of their environment can ruin derawan itsself.
Apart of the dirty beach around derawan, I should suggest you stay here if you have more money. Many value inn around derawan but they only provide room. What best is the dive lessons here, they really prepare for our safety and the equipment. They are really detailled for what you should and shouldn't do when you're scuba-diving. 
Many locals don't speak english. When you as them about derawan dive lodge, and they got confused, just tell them where to find "TASIK DIVERS". 100% sure they will direct you to the right place.
reviews.title: A nice dive lessons

name: Lapauta Derawan Resort
address: Derawan Island RT 03, Berau Indonesia

reviews.text: Me and my friends stayed here for two nights. They have several cottages and room types, but we've stayed at the standard room cottage. Standard room are small, no blanket, shared bathroom, and no amenities provided. But if you are out the whole day, this room is enough. Lapauta has it's own pier so boat can dock there to pickup or drop you off. Compared to BMI or derawan beach cafe, Lapauta doesn't have a snorkling spot near its area, but i can see they have a decent dive center. Lapauta restaurant has a nice view of the sunset, I'm sure everyone will enjoy it.
reviews.title: Enjoy the sunset

reviews.text:
This is the best one resort on Derawan Island, Lapatua Resort also provide sea tour snorkeling & diving to seeing whales, Sangalaki Island, kakaban Island & Maratua Island.
to reach the Derawan Island about 2 hours from Kalimarau Airport & by boat need  30 minutes, from Tanjung Batu Port
reviews.title: Nice Resort

reviews.text: Lapauta Restaurant was locaten in Derawan Island, in one building management with Lapauta Derawan Resort. Place was a good one, situated on a white sandy beach. During high tide you can watch fish swimming in the water below restaurant porch. Food was OK, mainly seafood served with tomato sauce or just simply baked or fried. They also served chicken and  vegetables. Cleanliness was admireable, the staff quickly clean up dishes after we finished our meal. We dud not spot any insects such as flies or cockroaches. Chef and staffs were polite and cheerful. It seems not only our family satisfied with the service provided by this restaurant, I noticed other customers were also happy with their lunch or dinner here. Recommended for your local culinary at Derawan Islands.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay and good resto

reviews.text: Recommended hotel in derawan island, a  nice and comfort hotel with sunset view in afternoon, nice service, good menu and delicious taste in lapauta resto. Not too expensive for a family trip, i will back next time
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with a good view

reviews.text:
We had one of the so called 'VIP' rooms, directly in front of the sea, open the door and have the sea in front of you. Also these rooms are the only ones with TV (HBO and Fox Movies) which is good as there is nothing to do on Derawan Island after sunset. Resort has its restaurant built out on the sea, means breakfast and dinner directly above the water with great views. Food is ok.
Bit strange was, that during the stay the room was not cleaned or made up, but only stayed two nights so did not care too much. Bring your own soap and shower gel.
Booked a day trip at the dive centre to Kakaban, this was an excellent trip with great boat, equipment and dive masters.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Sebagai penikmat wisata laut saya sangat suka untuk memilih menginap di resort yg berada di bibir pantai maupun berada di atas laut, salah satu tempat rekomended di derawan, makanan yang enak dan pemandangan yang menawan
reviews.title: Resort nyaman di pulau derawan

reviews.text: Mengunjungi pulau Derawan dan menginap di hotel ini sangat mengesankan. Pemandangan indah setiap harinya. Seafood segar di restaurant :-) Terimakasih untuk Borneo Diving yang sudah mengenalkan tempat ini.
reviews.title: Great view and great seafood!

reviews.text: hotelnya nyaman dan relatif masih baru, pemiliknya Pak Andi juga ramah. di sore hari bisa melihat sunset. berbeda dengan tempat penginapannya yang berada di pantai, restoran lapauta terletak di atas laut. makanannya enak, harganya juga terjangkau. diluar (didepan) kawasan hotel ada warung dan tempat penyewaan sepeda.
reviews.title: hotel yang cocok untuk liburan

reviews.text: Saat anda tiba di jetty / dermaga Lapauta Derawan Resort, anda sudah di suguhi pemandangan pantai dan air laut yang bening, kompleks resort yang hijau & asri yang dilengkapi dengan pantai, gazebo dan spot snorkling. Dan anda bisa berenang bersama penyu yang sering muncul di area pantai di depan Resort.
reviews.title: Resort yang memiliki semua yang anda inginkan saat berwisata

photos.caption: Gerbang saat akan masuk dari arah dalam pulau

reviews.text:
Pequeño resort que rodea un pequeño trozo de playa, que limpian a diario. Habitaciones muy sencillas distribuidas en módulos. El comedor se ubica sobre el agua, lo que lo hace más fresco. La playa está llena de maderas y restos de materiales. Se llega por mar al pier, y a continuación está un pequeño pueblo indonesio, de calles sin asfaltar, pero con todos los servicios (teléfono, restaurantes, banco...).
Lugar idóneo para servir de partida a viajes de buceo, teniendo en cuenta que no va a haber lujos. Las habitaciones tienen aire acondicionado, un pequeño baño con la ducha incorporada, el lavabo (mínimo) queda fuera. Sólo un armario, sin puerta ni baldas. Cortinas que no cubren por completo la ventana, por lo que entra luz. Sólo colocan sábana bajera y una manta en la cama.
Difícil obtener wifi (hay que insistir mucho, pero tienen).
El personal de cocina y limpieza es servicial y amable. Excelentes vistas, sobre todo al amanecer y anochecer.
reviews.title: Instalaciones sencillas atendidas por gente encantadora

name: Hotel Mitra
address: Jl. Gajah Mada no. 531 A Tanjung Redeb, Berau Indonesia

reviews.text: I stayed here on my return from Pulau Derawan in October 2016 awaiting my morning flight to Jakarta.  My bahasa is not so good but the staff were able to get me fed and bedded and on my way the next day with no problems.  Many RM. in the area within walking distance and the harbor on the river is nearby so it is a little like a port city anywhere in the world.  I would stay here again without question.  Wifi after two weeks off grid on Derawan was perfect to let me "catch up" with the news of the day.
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff

reviews.text:
Been coming here since 2012, and it's getting better and better: more rooms, always extremely clean and with AC. Wi-fi all around, for free. Good breakfast and 24/7 free coffee and tea included. 

It's not a fancy business hotel, so there's no warm water (but just shower in the afternoon, and it'll be warm because of the sun) and the satellite tv doesn't have American or European channels. 

Best thing: the staff are very friendly and helpful, it's a family-run place so they're all very involved in making it a nice experience for guests. They helped my wife a lot when she fell ill with dengue, getting medicine and getting her to and from a hospital.
reviews.title: Basic but clean, extremely nice and helpful staff

reviews.text: I loved this place. Basic room was clean with good cable and and wifi. They served a tasty breakfast. Short walk to the river food and drink stalls as well as the main drag. But what really made it was the delightful staff. Such genuinely nice people!
reviews.title: Very welcoming

reviews.text:
Personale molto gentile e disponibile. Mi sono venuti incontro per la colazione preparandomi un'omelette al posto del nasi goreng (riso) che portano intutte le camere. 
Purtroppo i muri delle camere sono impregnati di odore di sigaretta. Per chi è allergico o comunque sensibile può essere molto fastidioso. 
È un vero peccato perchè la struttura è ben tenuta e sono tutti molto carini. Un consiglio: rinfrescate le camere con una tinteggiatura e proibite di fumare all'interno.
reviews.title: Carino ma migliorabile

reviews.text: Kamar mandi ga ada bak hanya ada bak,kursinya hanya satu dan itu plastik, tidak ada selimut ekstra. Kelebihannya :air hangat, sarapan berupa nasi goreng.  Ga tau kenapa di mitra ga pernah diminta ktp padahal kalo ke hotel lain selalu diminta. Dan hal itu aneh menurut saya.
reviews.title: Mengecewakan

reviews.text:
menginap disini sangat betah,
- kondisi hotel sangat bersih, wangi,
- kamar mandi sangat bersih
- tapi sayang ga ada air panasnya
- tidak ada wifi baik di loby hotel ataupun di kamar
- model hotel ini seperti kos"an, 
- makan pagi diantar ke kamar masing
- harga relatif murah untuk kualitas bintang 3
- kamar pakai AC, ada saluran TV kabel
- lokasi strategis, jalan sedikit udah sampai di pinggiran sungai yg banyak orang jualan makanan
reviews.title: Hotel yang luar biasa

name: Cantika Swara Resort & Convention Hotel
address: Jln. Pulau Panjang no. 99, Berau 77311 Indonesia

reviews.text:
Hotel is bit out of the way, 30 minutes to the airport and you can take a driver to go for dinner somewhere in Berau, so location for me was not the issue.
Service: they told us that the hotel only had 3 or 4 rooms booked. Therefore breakfast will not be open at 6.00 am (we had early flight). So they said, breakfast will be brought up to room at 6.00 am. Breakfast did not come, when called, guy at reception said, there are breakfast boxes prepared. When coming down at 06.15, no breakfast boxes prepared, they started doing it, when driver to airport was already there. Left without breakfast boxes. 
No wifi except in lobby.
Room and bath room good and new.
Pool still under renovation (does not look like it will open soon), no gym, restaurant was closed when we were there.
reviews.title: Good room, that's it

reviews.text: The hotel looks so grand but do not stay here. First of all the hotel is far away from every where. The rooms are okay but they don't always clean it when we stayed there. Swimming pool under renovation. Spa not available. Nothing to do at night. Restaurant  uninspiring and out of various ingredients.
reviews.title: Things don't work

reviews.text:
Sorry about the title but that is just what it is
Large comfortable rooms, very clean, good food and fantastic, helpful staff
The grounds are well stocked and tidy
It is a little out of the way though and there isn't really anything to do
Ok for a night or two stopover
The hotel does have wifi but it wasn't working very well, actually not at all
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text:
Cantika Swara Resort memiliki kamar standar sebagai hotel. 
Beberapa fasilitas yang dimiliki membuat Cantika Swara Resort merupakan hotel terbaik di Kota Berau.

Beberapa kali terjadi pemadaman listrik, sehingga perlu kesigapan dalam mengantisipasi perpindahan listrik ke generator listrik yang dimiliki hotel.

Sampai sekarang, mungkin Cantika Swara Resort menjadi hotel yang nyaman untuk menginap di Kota Berau
reviews.title: Hotel Layak di Berau

reviews.text: Hotel tidak banyak dipenuhi oleh penghuni, lokasi hotel bukan dipusat kota sehingga cukup baik untuk mencari ketenangan namun sulit mencari makanan disekitar. Breakfast diantar ke kamar sehingga tidak banyak pilihan makanan yang tersedia (mungkin karena dibulan puasa).
reviews.title: Sesuai dengan harga

reviews.text:
Hotel ini terletak jauh dari pusat kota dan kebisingan. Cukup tenang dan kondisi kamar yang cukup representatif. Bagi Anda yang perlu ketenangan dan rileks hotel ini cukup bagus. Untuk keperluan charge HP atau laptop tidak tersedia kontak yang cukup. bila anda berdua dengan teman untuk kamar dengan twin bed tidak tersedia kamar no smoking. Selain itu jaringan wifi yang tersedia tidak terjangkau sampai ke kamar.

Terlihat hotel ini bersebelahan dengan bukit, kebetulan saya menempati kamar dengan pemandangan di depan saya bukit yang cukup rindang dengan pepohonan. Dengan kondisi warna cat dinding yang coklat membuat hotel ini agak terlihat gelap apalagi di malam hari. Untuk sarapan tidak disediakan secara prasmanan namun kami diberi pilhan tiga menu. Namun untuk menu yang ditawarkan tidak mengecewakan.
reviews.title: Cukup nyaman namun terkesan gelap

reviews.text:
Bisa dijadikan salah satu alternatif tempat istirahat di kota Tanjung Redeb/Berau serta tempat singgah apabila akan berlibur ke pulau Derawan. Susana kamar bagus dan bersih, namun sayang tidak menemukan tempat gantungan di area kamar mandi.
Fasilitas free internet wifi pun juga tidak ada sehingga bagi pengunjung yang akan berinteraksi melalui jaringan internet harus menggunakan paket data masing-masing smartphonenya. Selain itu kolam renang yang kurang terawat dalam perawatan air kolamnya sehingga sangat mubadzir fasilitas yang ada tidak terpakai.
Area ballroom/convention hall sangat cocok untuk keperluan rapat dengan jumlah peserta yang cukup besar
reviews.title: Menarik namun...

reviews.text: Saya mengunjungi area ini saat mengikuti RAKERNIS Kepariwisataan 2016 akhir februari tadi. Area nya cukup luas dan bersih, meeting roomnya sangat nyaman. Ada areal parkir, smooking room dan pelayanannya ramah dan rapi.
reviews.title: Resort megah di tengah kota Tanjung Redeb

reviews.text: Menginap dua malam di hotel ini sebenarnya cukup nyaman. Khusus soal kamar kebetulan saya dapat kamar yang cukup bagus. Air panas, handuk maupun toiletris tersedia di kamar. Desain kamarnya cukup bagus, dengan view ke taman yang cukup bagus. Sayangnya saat hendak berenang kolamnya kotor. Seperti jarang dibersihkan. Malam pertama Wifinya rusak dan ini mengganggu sekali. Namun di malam kedua wifi sudah berfungsi dengan cukup bagus.
reviews.title: Hotel Bagus dengan Layanan Standar

photos.caption: Kolam renang di bagian tengah hotel

reviews.text: Berdasarkan penampakannya, ini seharusnya hotel bagus. Tapi sayang, layanannya buruk. Saya menempati kamar lantai satu, pool view. Kunci pintu kaca ke pool sehiingga kalau mau ke kolam renang harus jalan memutar lewat pintu depan. Sabun cair mandi habis, pengetahuan stafnya tidak memadai saat ditanyakan berapa jam menuju Pulau Derawan. Selain itu, WiFi error. air saat mandi lemban terserap sehingga mandi genangan.
reviews.title: Hotel Bagus Dengan Layanan Mengecewakan

reviews.text: Tampak luar hotel terlihat sangat megah dan mungkin termasuk yang termegah di kota Berau, tapi tidak sebanding dengan fasilitas dan servis yang ditawarkan: fasilitas sangat tidak terawat dan servis sangat lama response nya.
reviews.title: Great appearance, poor facility and service

name: Hotel Millenium
address: M Ayoeb Gg. Ketapang Jln. H Abdullah, Berau 77311 Indonesia

reviews.text:
Stayed there for a transit night. Room is not bad but lookes very worn. The wall even had holes in it! Also there is no sink.
Worst: staff waked us up at 6:30 in order to tell us that breakfast is ready! Our flight was at 11:30 so we were looking forward to sleep a lttle longer in the morning..
Good things: good ac, cable tv

Appaerently there are not so good hotel options in Berau (for now)
reviews.title: Average and overpriced

reviews.text:
Hotel Millenium Is an Ok place to stay -- the quality depends on what you want to pay: there are two buildings, facing each other, seemingly "out in the sticks!" One building is the VIP, for AC rooms-- I was poorly informed, and chose a room with fan --I was distracted, making the room choice. The sheet definitely looked "laid-upon," with its various wrinkles. The cleaning and desk staff declared it was clean, yet I was unconvinced: I asked for +received a clean sheet+pillowcases. The bed was quite comfortable, giving a good night's sleep ! A big downfall was the bathroom-- which I had failed to check out:: there was no sink !! right, NO SINK !!! the water was cold, tho refreshing, and gave a good shower. The baseboard tiles were pulled away from the wall.
   The food I ordered was tasty and quite ok, a good bargain ! The staff did print out my three boarding passes. There seems to be only one guy who really does understand English, tho all the staff really do want to be helpful. My taxi ride to the airport early the next morning was only 75,000Rp. I would recommend trying the VP rooms at the Millenium -- it turned out that a couple dive buddies were indeed staying in the other building !
reviews.title: TWO Buildings = TWO QUALITIES !!

photos.caption: Baseboard tiles pulled away from wall

reviews.text: Hotel alla periferia di Berau, cittadina della regione del Kalimantan in Indonesia. Tappa necessaria per recarsi nelle isole per fare snorkeling. Albergo molto modesto con un bagno ridotto ai minimi termini . Presenza di insetti. Noi eravamo alloggiati nel secondo edificio di fronte all'albergo. Grave errore. Purtroppo lo abbiamo scoperto il mattino successivo. Servizio e personale scadenti. Colazione appena sufficiente. Felici di andare via.
reviews.title: Di passaggio

reviews.text: Lokasi strategis, dekat dengan bandara dan pusat keramaian. Staf ramah dan helpful. Stay semalam di kamar yg cuma pake fan tapi nggak gerah. Kamar mandi bersih. Overall nyaman dan puas dengan harga yang murah
reviews.title: Recommended

name: Berau Plaza Hotel
address: Jl. Pangeran Antasari Tanjung Redeb, Berau Indonesia

reviews.text:
Kalau ingin menginap dengan budget seminim mungkin, hotel ini bisa dipilih
Untuk fasilitas standar saja, tapi pelayanannya kurang ramah, dan airnya juga sering mati..
Makanan untuk sarapannya juga tidak variatif, jadi sebaiknya cari makanan di luar saja..
reviews.title: Pelayanan dan fasilitas kurang tidak baik

reviews.text: Hotel ini termasuk hotel yang lama ada di Tanjung Redeb.. dekat dengan pusat kota. Malam hari banyak tempat makan disekitar hotel dan tidak jauh dari tepian sungai untuk bersantai. Kamar tidak terlalu sempit. Pelayan dan kebersihan kamar lebih ditingkatkan lagi. Menu sarapan standar hotel budget.. Untuk sekedar tidur lebih dari cukup..
reviews.title: Standar Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel ini menjadi altenatif pilihan terakhir jika hotel di kota Tanjung Redeb penuh. Untuk sekedar tidur cukup lah.. Fasilitas didalam kamar bisa dibilang minim. Air mineral saja tidak ada. TV masih tipe tabung alias jadul. Menu sarapan terbilang seadanya. Tapi jika ingin makan diluar hotel banyak sekali pilihan tempat makan..
reviews.title: ..Hotel Lama Minim Fasilitas..

name: Derawan Lestari 1 Cottage
address: Berau 77381 Indonesia

reviews.text: Just came back from staying at this cottage. The owner was so helpful and friendly. They got their own pier. Delicious home made foods, love their tomatoes sambal. Air conditioned and clean room. I suggest you to have a room at the very end room, next to the patio. Local residents are very close, less than 5minutes walk, ATM mesin at the end of the walk to village, right at left corner. They owner has their own speedboat possible to arrange hoping island with them. Cant wait to get back.
reviews.title: Well Managed

name: Hotel Nirwana
address: Rt 11 Jln. SMA Aminuddin, Berau 77312 Indonesia

reviews.text: Hotel ini dari depan mungkin terlihat kecil, namun saat memasuki kedalam, sangat panjang dan luas di belakang. terdiri dari 2 lantai dengan harga kamar standar 200 rb an. Double bed, kipas angin, tv, kamar mandi di dalam. free breakfast, dan ada wifi gratis di lobby.
reviews.title: Hotel sederhana yang luas dan terjangkau bagi traveller

photos.caption: View depan hotel nirwana dari lantai 2

name: Lamin Guntur EcoLodge
address: Teluk Sumbang, Biduk Biduk, Berau 77373 Indonesia

reviews.text:
what a beautiful beach with white sand so soft. and the best part is amazing sunrise, I have the sunrise in the morning, exactly out the front my cabin. 

i saw sea turtle with all of kind sizes amazing around the beaches
reviews.title: an unforgettable Sunrise moment

photos.caption: The sand is wonderfully white. lovely place to stay

name: Kedai Kopi Kampus Singkuang
address: Jalan Dr. Murjani III, Berau 77315 Indonesia

reviews.text: nice place and services to stay in berau city, they have bike,motocycle and car for rental.  the price very low and the staff are helpful. They have great coffeeshop and the meals very delicious. you can arranged your traveling here, cause the owner is local guide in maratua island
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in Berau City

name: Derawan Indah Hotel
address: Jalan Panglima Batur Tanjung Redeb, Berau Indonesia

reviews.text:
I just checked in, couple hours ago. When I asked for wi-fi password, they gave me unique number as usual but couldn't connect with any wi-fi network when I arrived at my room. I don't know why.

Well, I know my room is a end-year price so i get the half of the price, but come on, i need that wi-fi than any facilities.

Okay, the staffs are okay, diligent, and kind. They helped me and bow down when I want to go out or get in to the hotel. The room is clean, pillows is crunchy, and the toilet is quite neat.
reviews.title: Wi-Fi tidak berfungsi!

reviews.text: Good Chinese food. Good range -They even have Szechwan eggplant!  Clean environment. They put the fried garlic on the long beans and the steam fish which make it good. Fried chicken with spices also good. They even have Szechwan eggplant!
reviews.title: Great Chinese restaurant

reviews.text:
Don't expect luxury, but this hotel is quite clean and comfortable. 
Maybe not as fancy as Chantika, Palmy or Bumi Segah hotels, but again it was much cheaper.  The location is definitely better than Bumi Segah and Chantika.  Very close to food stalls that sell mostly fresh seafood.  Two excellent nasi kuning for breakfast to the left and right of the hotel.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location, but it is expensive for ehat you get.  The bed is comfortable and the shower is good, but the decor is poor, with peeling paint.  Also, there is no sound-proofing at all, so you don't sleep well.  The advertised wifi wasn't working at all.  the poor is good and clean and filled with local children who are non guests.  The breakfast was quite good.  You can stay in better places for less money.
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get

reviews.text:
This is not a luxury hotel where you'll get pampered, but it is a great place to spend the night en route to or from Derawan. It's in the centre of town just back from the river. It has its own restaurant but there are also plenty of food stalls by the river in the evening and also a few shophouse style places to eat. There are 24 hr BNI ATMs accepting foreign cards both near the hotel and just down by the river (the one by the hotel was out of cash when we were there though.

Rooms are basic but clean and quiet. You'll hear the early call to prayer from a nearby mosque, but it's a Muslim country after all. The bathroom was fine. There's a little shop opposite the hotel with basic stuff like toothbrushes etc. Breakfast is mostly Asian style but there's a good enough range. They also open early enough for you to eat before even the first flights in the morning. 

There's free wifi, but the signal's fairly weak away from the large lobby area so we just sat there and did our online stuff

Just one word of warning if you booked flights from overseas. The airport's not far but go in plenty of time. It took us well over an hour to check in and pay airport tax because Srivijaiya's system failed. (They have no manual back up process). Luckily our flight was delayed due to fog or we'd have missed it...
reviews.title: Clean, safe and good value

reviews.text: Hotelkamer is basaal met goed bed , airco en tv. Warm en koud water. Helaas hing er een onprettige geur in de kamer. Er is geen raam dat open kan voor de ventilatie.  WiFi alleen in de lobby. Ontbijt is inbegrepen en een goed buffet. Ik had een diner met nasi goreng en een smakeloos gebakken  stuk kip voor 150.000 rp.
reviews.title: Duur en slecht restaurant

reviews.text:
Las habitaciones están limpísimas y el personal es encantador. El baño también, con jabones, cepillos de dientes...
El desayuno está muy bien, todo muy asiático. Alrededor hay muchas tiendas y restaurantes, la zona está bien.
reviews.title: Buen hotel y buen desayuno

reviews.text: Kamarnya luas Dan bersih. Overall puas. Untuk hotel dengan harga 500 menurut saya agak kemahalan tapi jika dibandingkan dengan biaya hidup di berau sesuai aja. Untuk sarapan saya tidak bisa menilai karena saya sarapan di luar. Untuk lokasi strategis,dengan dengan solomart dan tenpat makan enak. Jika bosan bisa main ke tepian yang tinggal jalan kaki. Jika mau ibadah di masjid juga dekat. Untuk kekurangannya menurut saya : harga room service yang mahal dan tidak ada petunjuk arah kiblat
reviews.title: Lumayan

reviews.text: Menginap di hotel ini dalam rangka kerja dan hanya transit saja menunggu penerbangan pagi. Hotel ini  lumayan bagus untuk kota kecil sekelas berau. Hanya saja makanan yang disajikan untuk sarapan tidak ada yang istimewa
reviews.title: Hotel murah di lokasi strategis

reviews.text:
Hotel de inspiración occidental. Habitaciones sencillas, sin lujos, con aire acondicionado. Se echa de menos una luz auxiliar para leer en la cama. El baño tiene la zona de ducha sin ninguna separación, sin mampara o cortina, con lo que resulta imposible no encharcarlo. El personal habla inglés, aunque no deben prestar mucha atención ya que a pesar de decir al recepcionista de la tarde que necesitábamos un taxi para el aeropuerto a primera hora, el del día siguiente no sabía nada.
Pero lo peor es que las habitaciones no están aisladas del ruido. Primero por mala educación de algunos clientes que estuvieron metiendo ruido en el pasillo y después por las oraciones del almuédano (por altavoces de 4.00 a 5.00 am), no pegamos ojo esa noche. Si alguien necesita alojarse en ese hotel que no olvide tapones para los oídos...
reviews.title: Imposible descansar por el ruido

reviews.text: Hotel yang lumayan sangat bagus di tanjung redep, fasiltas ada kolam renang, standarnya lumayan mahal sekitar 500 ribuan. Dari pusat perkantoran pemerintah daerah lumayan jauh, untuk kunjungan kerja memerlukan transportasi yang lumayan mahal.
reviews.title: Kunjungan Kerja

reviews.text: Une nuit suffit, hôtel de transit avant l'archipel de Derawan, l'hôtel est prétentieux avec un hall immense mais des chambres petites et plutôt basiques. Les salles de bains sont assez sommaires. L'entretien laissé à désirer, l'ascenseur n'est pas nettoyé.... Le petit déjeuner est très moyen. La connexion wifi est déficiente, on peut trouver un meilleur rapport qualité prix à Berau.
reviews.title: Hôtel prétentieux mal entretenu

reviews.text:
Satu-satunya hotel di Tanjung Redeb yang saat ini menyediakan kolam renang. Kamar standarnya mahal, 500ribu 😧, yah rata-rata di Tanjung Redeb memang seharga itu. Tapi lebih murah dari pada di Palmy Hotel, tapi tidak tersedia kolam renang.

Kamarnya cukup luas, kamar mandi juga okay. AC baru dan nyaman.
reviews.title: Bagus

reviews.text:
Hotel ini merupakan salah satu hotel terbaik di Tanjung Redeb, Berau
servicenya bagus dan rate-nya worth it.
Berlokasi agak jauh dari kota Berau, tapi dekat ke Bandara
overall worth it, tapi jauh kalau mau ke kota.
Cocok kalau mau jalan ke Tanjung Selor atau Tanjung Batu
reviews.title: Keren tapi Jauh dari kota!!

reviews.text: Untuk ukuran kota Tanjung Redep Hotel ini termasuk sangat bagus. Pakai Lift dan Room nya cukup luas. Ada fasilitas kolam renang dan tenis lapangan. Sayang sarapannya masih sederhana dan kamar mandinya juga biasa. Tapi secara umum hotel ini cukup bagus untuk berwiasata di Berau
reviews.title: Kunjungan bisnis

reviews.text:
abbiamo soggiornato una notte in questo albergo e ne sono rimasto molto deluso.

name: Rumah Kedaung Guesthouse and Cafe
address: Jl. Kedaung, Borneo IV, Sei Bedungun, Tanjung Redeb, Berau 77352 Indonesia

reviews.text:
We stayed twice on our way to and from the Derawan islands. On the face of it, this is a beautiful little resort. The wooden bungalows are set in a pleasant garden and we were pleased with the size and decor of the room. Food is nice and the staff, whilst speaking limited English are friendly. 

However, on our first stay, when we went to get in to bed we discovered it had not been changed since the previous guest had stayed in it. There were hairs and a stain and the pillows did not smell clean. We informed the staff and they were apologetic and immediately changed the sheets. We thought (hoped) it was an oversight.

On our second stay we check the bed immediately and guess what - hairs in the bed and smelly pillows. They promised to change the bed whilst we were out at dinner. When we returned, we discovered they had moved us to a different room. We never found out why. This time the bed was clean but the bathroom was not. Someone with a poor aim had left  pee stains on the toilet seat and the sink was dirty. This is just not acceptable. We're of the impression that because they have so many guests staying just one night, they get a little lazy.

If you choose to stay, check the cleanliness of the room immediately.
reviews.title: Check your bed linen!

reviews.text: This place was a wonderful surprise - we stayed a night at this great, well tended guesthouse. The bungalows are located within a beautiful garden- everything was really clean and the bungalows were well equipped- the hot shower was great!! The staff was friendly and very welcoming; we enjoyed the homemade cooking- nasi goreng with veggies and seafood. We really recommend this guesthouse!
reviews.title: A great place to be for a night or two- a wonderful stopover on the way to Derawan or the Wehea region.....

reviews.text: We spent in this nice guesthouse two nights, one waiting our speedboat to Derawan and the second one coming back from the islands waiting for our flight back to Balikpapan. The hotel is really smart! There are several bungalows in a big garden, they are well furbished, nett and absolutely clean. All of them have a balcony and the rooms are well enlightened with big windows. Bathrooms are well kept with hot shower. The staff is really nice though they speak English only a little bit. If you need a driver to Tanjung Batu or a taxi to the airport, they can help you but...please bargain...They overprice these services a bit. Right price to airport in this moment is 75000rp; to Tanjung Batu,( two persons, sharing a taxi with other two) we paid 250000 ( for two)...We had the impression we could ask even a lower price...( At the beginning we had been asked 700000rp!). Breakfast is included and it's ok. In March 2016 we spent with booking.com 385000rp for a double room. Very good price for what they give. Wi fi is working pretty well. The centre of Berau is not behind the corner but can be reached with public transport ( blue minivan). Berau is nice and....CLEAN!!!!!! ( first clean town in kalimantan after one month!) There is a nice market and a nice hindu temple...Good atmosphere. We strongly recommend this hotel and this town.
reviews.title: A nice spot in the nature in a smart town....Waiting the boat to Derawan!

reviews.text: Penginapan nya cukup menarik dan nyaman.  Bangunan yg terbuat dari kayu membuat suasana nya tenang, kamarnya ber AC, ada air hangat,  dan tersedia fasilitas wifi.  Namun, fasilitasnya nya perlu ditingkatkan untuk sarapan masih kurang. Mungkin saat kemaren kita datang stok gas habis, jadi tidak dapat sarapan
reviews.title: Cukup baik
